programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: An excited Len prepares for the arrival of new foster daughter Laura, and Logan provides a safe haven for battered local lad Albert Tooley when he goes AWOL from the Army. Nancy inspires the Rev Brewer to turn his hand to poetry and Mary confides in Deborah that she fears Albert may be coming back to woo her, unaware she and Cyril have tied the knot. Rural drama, starring Richard Wilson and Oliver Milburn

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Phyllis chooses Donald as her consort for Ormston's annual festival of love and relationships, while Nancy wastes no time coaxing a reluctant Logan onto the dance floor. Len's overweight cousin Elton Smith arrives to act as chef for the Apple Day celebrations, but it's not long before he finds himself in hospital after making a confession to Linda about a critical medical condition. Rural drama, starring Richard Wilson, Maggie Steed, Oliver Milburn and Nick Holder

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Deborah tries to move on with her life after Tom's death and helps arrange a lunch date for Nancy and Logan - advising her sister to dress more demurely if she wants to be accepted as a potential doctor's wife. A heavily pregnant Emma is placed next to Laura in hospital, and when both women develop a fever, Donald is called in to help, but seems strangely unconcerned - leaving Phyllis determined to find out why

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Henry Williamson returns to Ormston to keep an eye on things in Donald's absence, and Nancy uses her feminine wiles to ensnare Logan, but it's Deborah who ends up spending the night with him during a storm. In a battle of the sexes, Nancy and Wilf agree to swap jobs, while drains man Charlie Polson believes love is the only drug to cure his manic depression - until his clumsy wooing of assistant Hettie Jenkins lands him in hospital. Rural drama, starring Nigel Havers, Kelly Harrison and Oliver Milburn

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Jack learns from his solicitor that his case must go to court. Lynne wonders what she and Frere have in common

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Frere strengthens his hold on Lynne. Jack calls in a favor to dig deeper into Shellet's criminal past

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe is assigned to protect a sausage factory from animal rights protesters and Margaret fears that her widowed friend Julia is about to be swindled by the debonair Anthony, who has invited her to invest heavily in a business venture. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Sheila Gish

programme.title: Campion
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert investigates the baffling case of a man who dies and is buried, only to turn up dead again three months later. Peter Davison and Brian Glover star in the mystery drama

programme.title: Campion
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert solves the baffling case of a man who apparently died twice. Peter Davison and Brian Glover star in the mystery drama series based on Margery Allingham's stories

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The owner and curator of Brokenwood's Historic Village, Charity Highmore-Browne, dies after being struck by an arrow. Mike and his team delve into the realm of New Zealand's colonial past as they deal with suspects including a blacksmith, a missionary, the local postmaster and the victim's sister. Neill Rea stars

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Long-buried secrets are revealed, putting Strike and Robin in danger as they close in on Lula's killer. Robin receives key information from a salesgirl at the boutique Lula visited, Strike asks Bristow about Lula's attempts to trace her biological roots and the impact on her adoptive family, while John points out that he, Tony and Yvette all have an alibi. However, Strike manages to unravel Tony's alibi as the truth about Lula's death is finally revealed. Tom Burke and Holliday Grainger star

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Oscar's second wife Maya arrives in London. As the family attempts to heal past divisions and celebrate the future, Hannah and Nathan fight to save their marriage. Elsewhere, Goldie finally has her day in court, only to discover a secret that changes everything. As Ruth fights to save all that she has worked for, help comes from an unusual source - but at a price. And Hannah, after receiving heartbreaking news about Christie, finally confronts the past. Abi Morgan's drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The moderator-elect of the Church of Scotland and a female companion are found naked in a car with their throats cut, but the church closes ranks as Rebus investigates the background to the case, uncovering long-buried rivalries, lies and grudges within the institution. Meanwhile, a retired police colleague in the early stages of dementia claims he is being poisoned by staff at his nursing home. Drama, starring Ken Stott, with Lorcan Cranitch, Andrew Neil and John Stahl

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Simon is ready to take on legal duties again, but his old ways see him involved with the wife of the local cricket captain. Olivia Godfrey, the owner of a sex shop, hires Peter to resolve a problem with the sponsorship deal she has with a sports club. Meanwhile, Henny Leach, a self-professed eco-warrior, proves to be a bit of a handful for Lyle and not as innocent as she makes out. Drama, starring Stephen Fry, with guest stars Miriam Margolyes and John Thomson

programme.title: Small Island
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jamaican woman travels to London in 1948 to join her new husband, but her life becomes entwined with that of her landlady, who once spent a night of passion with the young bride's former love. Adaptation of Andrea Levy's novel, starring Naomie Harris, Ruth Wilson, David Oyelowo, Ashley Walters and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Nick Klein returns to work determined to prove himself to his colleagues, while Eva Sharpe struggles to keep her emotions in check after an investigation ends in tragedy. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The team try to protect the final resident of the flats owned by ruthless property developer Charles Vanderbilt, but he's not to be put off so easily, and Cameron Tait and Nick Klein are soon caught up in an explosive situation. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro resolves to bring crooked property developer Charles Vanderbilt to justice. Nick Klein and Cameron Tait play right into Phil Hunter's hands when they cover up the truth about their encounter with hardman Conrad, and June Ackland goes back on the trail of the Internet burglar - but a shock revelation from Laura Meadows leaves her reeling

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: June Ackland and Adam Okaro arrange for Laura Meadows' rape to be investigated by officers at Barton Street. Gary Best is disappointed when his romantic birthday rendezvous with Honey Harman turns out to be a surprise party, but Debbie McAllister and Juliet Becker take the opportunity for some quality time together, and Polly Page's celebratory mood is shattered by the arrival of DCI Ross

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner opens a new screening clinic for cervical cancer, and one of the first patients is a woman who is about to be married and has never had a period. Trixie supports her as she discovers she has a rare condition, but the diagnosis could have far more devastating repercussions than either of them could have imagine. Sister Frances confronts her fear of public speaking, Lucille has a new romance in her life, and a father-to-be experiences strange pains similar to his wife's pregnancy symptoms

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Mother Mildred returns to Nonnatus while Nurse Crane is in hospital receiving treatment for her back. With help from Trixie, she provides care for a retired dock worker whose former job has taken its toll on his health, only to discover his son may be suffering from a more severe condition. However, her insensitive manner angers the family and they refuse to let her help them

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Edward Barbary is left facing financial ruin and the situation only gets worse Scrooge comes calling, demanding his loan be repaid. Amelia is devastated by the loss of Jip, but receives an unexpected visit from Compeyson, who gives her a present and makes a surprising declaration

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson is officially courting Miss Havisham and, in order to seem a more credible suitor, he demands money from Arthur, who is forced to sell personal family items to obtain the money. Elsewhere, Honoria is determined to solve her father's debt problems and avoid an arranged marriage with Sir Leicester, while the Bumbles entertain Mr Gradgrind, and the Cratchits worry about Tiny Tim. Starring Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: After Arthur almost gives the game away, Compeyson tries to win over Amelia in the hope of exerting influence on her business decisions. After visiting her father in the debtors' prison, Honoria reluctantly agrees to meet with Sir Leicester to discuss their courtship. Meanwhile, Inspector Bucket discovers that Jacob Marley owned a warehouse by the docks, the Bumbles hear some exciting work news, and Silas Wegg notices that Mrs Gamp has been helping herself to his gin

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Black Velvet Gown
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama set in 19th-century rural Northumberland about a penniless widow who flouts convention to have her children educated above their class - an act of kindness that gives rise to tragic consequences. Bob Peck and Janet McTeer star

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface uncovers a case of life imitating art when a local Amateur Dramatics performer actually dies on stage

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the quirky crime drama. A dead body impossibly vanishes from a locked study - giving self-styled paranormal investigator Joey Ross a fresh mystery to solve. She could do with some help from her old sidekick, the master of illusion Jonathan Creek - but he has moved on and shows little interest in the case. As Joey starts digging she meets the investigating officer - Gideon Pryke, a sharp-minded DI who remembers Creek from one of his previous cases. But he's not quite the man he used to be. Alan Davies stars, with Sheridan Smith, Rik Mayall, Joanna Lumley and Nigel Planer

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies returns as the master illusionist, who has retired from crime-solving to join the corporate world with wife Polly. However, he is soon tempted back to help investigate a seemingly impossible attack on a West End actress - and he's not alone, as a criminology student tags along for a spot of 'work experience'. At the same time, a personal tragedy for Jonathan and Polly uncovers a series of dark and disturbing secrets. Sarah Alexander co-stars, with Paula Wilcox, Ali Bastian, Raquel Cassidy, Kieran Hodgson and Rhydian Jones

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective must confront a demon from his past, as both the police and Cornelius converge on his home. With Halliday convinced that the body in the morgue isn't their killer, can Luther put his own troubles to one side and find the true murderer before he strikes again? Thriller, starring Idris Elba, Ruth Wilson and Dermot Crowley

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: Father Michael visits the Demichelis children who are struggling to cope, but his offer of help is initially rejected by Chloe, whose anger results in drastic action. To her surprise, she gains support from an unlikely quarter. The inquest into Vernon's death begins, with Father Michael, Helen, and the officers in question all summoned to give evidence. PC Andrew Powell has to make a tough call - support his colleagues or tell the truth? And will being under oath lead Father Michael to confess to more than he has before? Drama, starring Sean Bean

programme.title: Small Island
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part adaptation of Andrea Levy's novel, set in post-war London. Hortense becomes disillusioned with life in England when she encounters racism and fails to find employment, but Gilbert and Queenie rally round to help her adjust. However, the return of Bernard, the landlady's husband, threatens to change everything. Drama, starring Naomie Harris, Ruth Wilson, David Oyelowo and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.desc: Steve Brown is in his home county of Kent, helping two sisters to buy a house each. He also meets a family who have been restoring traditional oast houses for four generation

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: A mother puma must battle rivals, tackle prey nearly three times her size and endure the wild mountain weather of Patagonia in her bid to raise four cubs

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the aftermath of one of the biggest fires to ever engulf the UK countryside, Joe Crowley and John Craven explore the impact of increasing wildfires. Joe is in the Scottish Highlands to meet people who have been tackling a wildfire that has been burning since May, while John is in Surrey to reveal how nature reserves can be adapted to stop fire in its tracks. Plus, Adam Henson looks at fire safety on a farm

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow is at Stonor Park in Oxfordshire, where finds include a rare group of Indian medals, Florence Nightingale's toolkit and the story of a remarkable female pilot from the Second World War. There is also an intriguing painting by an unknown artist, some computer generated art with a surprisingly high value and a collection of rare pearls from around the world

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Harry is reunited with Stan in the Sahara Desert, but soon finds that the realities of desert combat are very different to what he is used to. In Paris, Henriette is placed in grave danger when she discovers the Gestapo are hunting for her brother, a situation that could jeopardise the Resistance escape route. Lois recovers from her injuries, but the psychological trauma could take longer to fade

programme.title: Braveheart (1995)
programme.desc: Account of the life of medieval Scottish hero William Wallace. After the slaughter of his father and brother, young Wallace is taken in by his uncle, who teaches him how to use not only his brawn but his brain - which he employs to great effect years later when he resolves to drive the English out of Scotland. Oscar-winning historical epic, directed by and starring Mel Gibson. With Patrick McGoohan, Sophie Marceau and Catherine McCormack

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The stories of beat coppers who stumble upon a key piece of evidence and bring a major criminal to justice. A car running a red light leads officers into a chase with an armed criminal, and a suspicious death leads to the discovery of a deadly poison plot. Presented by Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a giraffe whose weight-loss could mean a crisis for the whole herd, while Ben Fogle finds out which eucalyptus leaves koalas like best and Jean Johansson serves up some refreshing fish lollies for the tigers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Dion Dubllin and Tommy Walsh explore properties in Brixton, south London, Chesterton in Staffordshire and Chelmsford, Essex, and ask the buyers about their plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Epsom in Surrey, and hails a hackney cabs to take him across London. The Reds and the Blues are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Businesswoman and Dragons' Den star Sara Davies takes Robson gorge-walking in Teesdale to introduce him to her way of getting close to nature. After overnighting in a shepherd's hut on a cheese farm, Robson heads to nearby Barnard Castle before visiting the nearby Raby country estate

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps an animal-loving house hunter from Oxfordshire to find a village property in Dorset, ideally close to the coast, and also visits a luxury yacht manufacturer

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam are in Stotfold, Bedfordshire, to create a colourful, peaceful retreat for Daniel and Saleha. The couple are both sun worshippers and would like colour and drama incorporated into the design, as well as a water feature, while Saleha has also asked for some nods to her Bangladeshi heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst explore Cumbria in a campervan, picking up a Scots Guards picture, a rare Scottish jug, and some silver jewellery

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Konnie Huq in the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Distraught Keanu desperately seeks ways to get Peggy back but is heartbroken to discover that a legal battle through the Portuguese courts could take years. Stacey plans a romantic rendezvous at the allotments with Martin, only to realise she has double booked with her client. Kathy is fuming at the knowledge Suki will be going on her honeymoon after Rocky lost it in a poker game to Nish, and Howie gives Kim a pep talk

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: The true picture comes to light when Thames Valley Police open an investigation. The police trawl through evidence and make a connection between Peter's and Ann's symptoms. They have a working hypothesis, but what they desperately need is proof. Evidence starts to pile up and the police soon realise that they could be dealing with a frighteningly complex and calculating criminal mind

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy's dark history surfaces as she and Baba don Halloween masks to gain entry to her old school. Jackson and Lola find evidence that links the pair to the third victim, but will they join the dots in time to save a fourth? Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Ordinary Love (2019)
programme.desc: When loving wife Joan feels a lump in her breast, she and husband Tom attempt to navigate the world of serious illness, including the surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Lisa Barros D'Sa and Glenn Leyburn's critically acclaimed drama based on a script by playwright Owen McCafferty, starring Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson and Esh Alladi

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Colombia v Korea Republic (Kick-off 3.00am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group H, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. Colombia last appeared in this tournament in 2015, when they reached the last 16, while the Koreans were eliminated in the group stage four years ago. With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels help Chipmunk deliver his packages

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: As Peggee and the Hummingbirds journey up the river to deliver a parcel, they have fun spotting and avoiding the wildlife that they meet along the way

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Grape Kids learn how to camp Supertato-style, but Evil Pea arrives and wows them with her ice camping

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer tries to keep the Farmer's new trainers spotlessly clean

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Miss Mistry offers thumb wrestling as a solution to resolve Dennis and Walter's spiralling competitiveness

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Sammi Kinghorn are in the Lake District finding out how cycling is still one of the top outdoor pursuits in the UK, and how electric bikes are opening up the countryside like never before. Adam Henson talks to farmers taking part in a sheep shearing competition, and Tom Heap explores the impact of banning snares

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Zambia v Japan (Kick-off 8.00am). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group C, which takes place at Waikato Stadium in Hamilton, New Zealand. Alex Scott presents, with commentary by Conor McNamara and Sue Smith

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The natural history documentary follows the work of tough Australian Chris 'Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to rescuing and raising orphaned kangaroos in the outback near Alice Springs. This two-part film follows Brolga as he expands operations by opening his doors to a whole new bunch of animals, including a trio of camels, a southern hairy-nosed wombat and three emu chicks, as well as building a wildlife hospital

programme.title: Undiscovered Worlds with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a team of experts - including world-leading underwater cave explorer Robbie Schmittner, former Royal Marine Aldo Kane and diving camera operator Katy Fraser - into the Yucatan Peninsula in Mexico. Under the vast jungle is the largest unexplored network of caves in the world, comprising thousands of kilometres of passageways. They are beautiful but dangerous, as much of the system is under water. First, the team must trek through tough, scorpion-infested jungles to camp alongside a giant sinkhole - a dark gateway to an underworld full of nightmarish creatures

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge challenges fellow chef Glynn Purnell to create a recipe from scratch to go up against his own new creation, with each having a set of rules to work from, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack tries to persuade them to be open-minded as he asks them to sample wine from a surprising source. Plus, comedy actress Arabella Weir meets a man who puts many chefs to shame when it comes to experimenting with flavour

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Denmark v China (Kick-off 1.00pm). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group D, which takes place at Perth Rectangular Stadium in Australia. The Danes are playing in their first World Cup since they were eliminated at the group stage in 2007, while China reached the last 16 four years ago in France. Gabby Logan presents, with analysis from Steph Houghton, Ellen White and Jonas Eidevall, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Rachel Brown-Finnis

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher offer up some designs to help Reena and Wes create more space in their three-bedroom 1960s terrace house in Borehamwood, which they've outgrown since moving in 12 years ago. With Wes often working from home, daughter Nyla's toys are competing for space with the desk and the kitchen doesn't have space for a table, so they eat all their meal on their knees in the living room. With family in Barbados and in the UK, Reena and Wes are desperate to create some space to get everyone together

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how the camera transformed the relationship between the monarchy and the British people during the 64-year reign of Queen Victoria, whose accession to the throne in 1837 coincided with the invention of photography. The monarch, whose private life became more visible than ever before, managed to turn the pursuit from a pastime into a political weapon in her battle to safeguard the British throne

programme.title: The Young Victoria (2009)
programme.desc: The turbulent early years of the monarch who, shortly after being crowned, became caught in a power struggle between her mother and scheming politicians Lord Melbourne and Sir Robert Peel. Meanwhile, a romance develops with her German cousin and eventual husband, Prince Albert. Historical drama, with Emily Blunt, Rupert Friend, Paul Bettany and Miranda Richardson

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, where Philip Serrell discovers a postcard signed by Malcolm Campbell showing him in his boat Bluebird. Jonathan Pratt gets excited about a collection of fans, while Paul gets aboard the Cutty Sark, the last surviving tea clipper

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day four of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Emirates Old Trafford. England will be looking to continue their exemplary record in Test matches at this venue since the turn of the century, which has seen them win 13 of the 19 contests and lose just once, although that loss was at the hands of Australia in 2019

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Action from the third day of the tournament, which takes place at Royal Liverpool Golf Club in Hoylake, Merseyside. Viktor Hovland and Rory McIlroy each recorded a six-under-par 66 at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament at St Andrews to rise to the top of the leaderboard in a share of first place, on an overall score of 16 under

programme.title: The Who at the Electric Proms
programme.desc: A 2006 performance by the veteran rock group at the Roundhouse in the London borough of Camden, featuring tracks including My Generation, Baba O'Riley and Pinball Wizard as well as material from the band's mini-opera Wire and Glass

programme.title: Quadrophenia (1979)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1960s London is unhappy with his lot in life, but believes he has found a place to belong in the mod subculture and their feud with the rival rockers. But bit by bit, his naive vision of the world is cruelly shattered. Drama based on the Who album, starring Phil Daniels, Leslie Ash, Sting and Ray Winstone

programme.title: The Who at Glastonbury
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe looks back at the rock band's headline set on the Pyramid Stage in 2007, when the veterans closed proceedings at that year's fetival

programme.title: Up There (2012)
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Sweden v South Africa (Kick-off 6.00am). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group G, which takes place at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Rachel Brown-Finnis and Jonas Eidevall, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Rachel Brown-Finnis

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Sweden v South Africa (Kick-off 6.00am). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group G, which takes place at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand. Alex Scott presents, with analysis from Rachel Brown-Finnis and Jonas Eidevall, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Rachel Brown-Finnis

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter Q, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson and Carole Baxter thin out the bamboo next to the pond and plant up a hanging basket full of herbs. Calum Clunie sends in the latest update from his allotment in Leven and George Anderson reveals a different way to propagate new plants. Plus, father-and-daughter gardeners Erin and Joe Armstrong work and garden together at their plot in East Lothian

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: The horticulturist presents a year-long diary about the life cycle of her garden at Glebe Cottage in Devon, where she offers seasonal advice and guidance, beginning with how to look after plants throughout January and February. She prunes the greenery, prepares the soil and plants garlic, before a local woodsman helps her lay a native hedge

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Jez and Ieuz continue their adventure across Europe in San Sebastian, where they tour the Spanish city's best tabernas sampling pintxos, before heading to Bordeaux

programme.title: Cleopatra (1963)
programme.desc: The famous Queen sets out to consolidate her power after gaining control of the Egyptian kingdom. She seduces Julius Caesar and bears him a son, but the ambitious would-be tyrant is assassinated before she can take her place at his side, paving the way for her love affair with general Mark Antony - and a war for control of the Roman empire. Historical epic, starring Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Martin Landau, Rex Harrison, Hume Cronyn and George Cole

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Lewis and Caroline Hawley visit Wolverhampton Art Gallery where they assess aboriginal art and a 1920s tennis racket. Plus, presenter Paul Martin finds out about the life of footballer Billy Wright, one of city's most famous sons

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull Kingston Rovers v Wigan Warriors (Kick-off 5.00pm). All the action from the semi-final at Headingley Stadium. Rovers claimed a 28-10 victory over Salford Red Devils in the quarter-finals and are now aiming to reach the showpiece match for the first time since they were runners-up to Leeds in 2015. Warriors are the holders, having defeated Huddersfield Giants 16-14 in last year's final, and they prevailed 14-12 against Warrington Wolves to reach this stage

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fifth and final day of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Emirates Old Trafford. Australia won by 185 runs when the sides last met here in this format in 2019, but England have won all four of their Tests at this venue since

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Action from the fourth and final day of the tournament, which took place at Royal Liverpool Golf Club in Hoylake, Merseyside. Cameron Smith of Australia was the victorious player at St Andrews last year after an excellent eight-under-par final round of 64 saw him finish one stroke clear of America's Cameron Young, with Northern Irishman Rory McIlroy in third

programme.title: Louis Theroux's Forbidden America
programme.desc: Louis immerses himself in Florida's multimillion-dollar rap scene, which is as notable for the controversy surrounding its emerging stars as its creativity. He spends time with a number of artists who are achieving success through self-promotion on social media, from those playing out fierce rivalries online to rappers live-streaming their often violent and chaotic lifestyles. While drawing in an ever-growing fanbase attracted to its unvarnished portrayal of real-life struggles and hardship, this content has also drawn the attention of the authorities, who see it as evidence of criminals indulging in illegal gang activity

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian travels to Mongolia, the most sparsely populated country on Earth. With the aid of a local TV host, he spends a week exploring the vast nation. He tries his hand at traditional wrestling and shamanic rituals, encounters an enormous statue of Genghis Khan, takes part in a hunting trip with eagles, and visits an energy centre in the middle of the desert. He also discovers how relationships are formed among nomadic societies, where people often live more than 100 miles away from anyone else

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Four new couples begin sessions with Dr Orna Guralnik, with Brock and Kristi unpacking their Mormon upbringing as they search for a new foundation, while Josh struggles with Natasha's lack of intimacy

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Christine's childhood PTSD surfaces, Josh's sexual frustration boils over, Erica reveals her resentment of Sean, and Brock struggles to lay bare Kristi's betrayal

programme.title: Joe Swash: Teens in Care
programme.desc: Joe Swash reveals the harsh reality of what it's like growing up in the care system, spending time with teenagers who are all at crucial stages of their life. Joe's mum Kiffy has been a foster carer for over 15 years and he wants to spend time with teens across the UK who live in foster care, in residential children's homes, and some who have left at 18 and are trying to make it alone, to show what growing up as a teenager in care is really like

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Eleanor and Rob from Hereford ask the team to help them make an eco-friendly garden for themselves and their two daughters to enjoy using recycled materials and a budget of £4,500

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: The team head to Beaconsfield Recycling Centre for items to upcycle. Jacqui finds a tired toolbox to transform, Sarah takes on a glass bookcase and Bruce finds a dated sideboard

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team reports from the biggest horticultural event in the north - the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries and growers in the country. Also, Nick Bailey shines a botanical spotlight on begonias, and Toby Buckland visits a Liverpool community who have regenerated their streets through collective gardening

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles explains how brave rescuers risked their lives evacuating residents from a burning high-rise. Plus, a woman who came to the aid of her best friend when she unexpectedly went into cardiac arrest

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader heads to Naples, immersing himself in its famous street life and trying his hand at crafting one of the city's characterful Nativity figurines and bagging a backstage pass to the world's oldest opera house

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Party's landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects of he Weimar Republic, Alex Higgins, the bridges of London, and UK cheeses, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two returnees and a newcomer make their way to the kitchen for the Central heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Sabrina Gidda from Wolverhampton is executive chef at AllBright, a women-only club in London. Newcomer Kray Treadwell from Solihull is head chef at Man Behind the Curtain in Leeds, while Ryan Simpson-Trotman - making his third appearance in the competition - runs his own restaurant, Orwells in Oxfordshire

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges three artists to create a suitable piece to celebrate the upcoming wedding of paraclimbing champion Richard and fiancee Keely. Can a metal sculptor, a stained-glass designer or a paint and textile artist create just what the pair are looking for?

programme.title: Made in Great Britain
programme.desc: The makers explore how Northampton became the shoe capital of Britain, as Steph McGovern takes them through the ages, guided by master shoemaker Scott McKee, who has hand-made shoes for dozens of high profile clients including Prince Charles and Daniel Craig. The makers start by recreating a 13th century turn shoe, then become part of the Victorian-era production line for the heeled Oxford shoe. Other tasks include producing a Second World-War marching boot that kitted out the British army and working on modern leather brogue boots

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to explore more of the US rail network, this time heading across the state of Alaska to examine the lives and customs of its inhabitants while armed with his 1899 Appleton's Guide-Book to Alaska, written by intrepid 19th-century explorer Eliza Ruhamah Scidmore

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts Catherine Southon and Katherine Higgins are at the Royal Marines Museum in Hampshire, where a 19th-century Japanese woodblock and a pristine pocket watch stimulate interest. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin learns how Portsmouth influenced the Victorian author Charles Dickens

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Sara Barron, Sanjeev Kohli, Josie Long and Gregg Wallace test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheep farming couple David and Charlotte, and father daughter duo James and Hannah compete with the best of their flocks at Kilnsey Show in the Yorkshire Dales

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: Hannah Fry delves into the inner workings of virtual assistants, like Google Assistant and Siri, which are now found in almost half of all UK homes. She goes behind the scenes with Alexa's chief scientist, reveals how secret technology invented to hunt U-boats led to their targeted hearing, and discovers modern wi-fi's debt to a 1940s Hollywood star

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as rock music fans the Roadies take on embroidery enthusiasts the Stitchers. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Way in, Outside the works, Mouth entertainment, and Little ovens

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Aberdeen pit their wits against a team from the University of Birmingham in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Amol Rajan asks the questions

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of the event 800 million years ago when almost the entire planet froze and the chances of life surviving hung in the balance. Earth's journey into the deep freeze started with fire when the giant supercontinent Rodinia broke up and vast powerful tectonic forces ripped the land apart, kicking off a series of events that resulted in huge amounts of carbon dioxide being sucked from the atmosphere - sending global temperatures plummeting

programme.title: That Mitchell and Webb Look
programme.desc: Sketches include a man who can move biscuits with his mind, and a clip from new daytime TV show Coverage of People Buying a House and Then Living in It. An evil henchman also makes a plea for death threats to be worded more clearly. David Mitchell and Robert Webb star. First aired in 2006

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The World's War: Forgotten Soldiers of Empire
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian and film-maker David Olusoga explores how Germany enlisted Muslims from north Africa and the Middle East to join the fight against Britain and its allies during the First World War. Muslim PoWs and deserters held in special camps in Germany were indoctrinated to see Kaiser Wilhelm II as a lover of Islam and a supporter of national independence wherever the British or French flags flew. General Paul von Lettow-Vorbeck led an army of east African troops in an insurgency that cost the lives of hundreds of thousands of black troops

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Following three shark attacks in two years just metres from a beach in the Red Sea vacation resort of Hurghada, Egypt, this documentary investigates the recent shift in shark behaviour and whether human activity and climate change could be the causes. Professor Gavin Naylor of the University of Florida looks back to the evolution of sharks for answers while Dr Dean Grubbs of Florida State University gets hands on, catching sharks to study and better understand their movements. Dr Laura Ryan, of Macquarie University, explains her research into a possible case of mistaken identity in which the sharks are mistaking humans for their preferred prey of seals.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Sammi Kinghorn are in the Lake District finding out how cycling is still one of the top outdoor pursuits in the UK, and how electric bikes are opening up the countryside like never before. Adam Henson talks to farmers taking part in a sheep shearing competition, and Tom Heap explores the impact of banning snares

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A series of burglaries allows police to crack county-lines drug-dealing conspiracy, a consumer complaint brings down a national SMS fraud and a jet-setting con-woman is brought to justice

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: Tony Bennett performs a selection of his best-loved songs at LSO St Luke's, London, including I Left My Heart in San Francisco, The Best Is Yet to Come, All of Me, They Can't Take That Away From Me and The Good Life

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the Great Plains - 500,000-square miles of flat, treeless grassland - became the setting for some of the Wild West's most dramatic events. Ray joins members of the Blackfeet Nation as they demonstrate bare-back riding skills before undertaking a ritual buffalo hunt and sacrifice. At a cattle auction in Dodge City, Kansas, he reveals stories about the railways and cow-towns before learning about the life of an iconic figure - the cowboy

programme.title: Beck
programme.desc: The Stockholm police are called out to investigate the killing of a man who was brutally murdered in his own home. Crime drama, starring Peter Haber. In Swedish

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Terry Wogan introduces a memorable edition of the game show in which a panel of celebrities fill in the blanks, hoping they have matched the contestants' answers. From January 1998

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.desc: In a programme originally broadcast in 1995, chat show host Michael Parkinson revisits memorable encounters with actor and comedian Frankie Howerd and a Christmas interview with slapstick magician Tommy Cooper. Featuring clips from Up Pompeii, The Main Attraction and The Bob Monkhouse Show

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary first shown in 1990 looking at the life of the comedian and actor, featuring highlights from his TV and film career. Contributors include Max Bygraves, Ned Sherrin, Johnny Speight, Eric Sykes, June Whitfield and Michael Winner

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Tony buys a new home from estate agent Sid - only to discover it backs onto an airfield. Vintage comedy, starring Tony Hancock and Sid James

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: On the eve of his wedding, Bob turns down the chance of going on a drunken rampage in favour of a quiet night in. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Terry Wogan introduces a memorable edition of the game show in which a panel of celebrities fill in the blanks, hoping they have matched the contestants' answers. From January 1998

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.desc: In a programme originally broadcast in 1995, chat show host Michael Parkinson revisits memorable encounters with actor and comedian Frankie Howerd and a Christmas interview with slapstick magician Tommy Cooper. programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: Tony Bennett performs a selection of his best-loved songs at LSO St Luke's, London, including I Left My Heart in San Francisco, The Best Is Yet to Come, All of Me, They Can't Take That Away From Me and The Good Life

programme.title: Being Beethoven
programme.desc: A profile of Ludwig van Beethoven, beginning by exploring his childhood, and his subsequent rise to fame as a piano virtuoso, then composer, in late 18th-century Vienna. Featuring Mark Padmore singing one of Beethoven's early lieder Adelaide, and conductor Marin Alsop talking about the premiere of the Ninth Symphony

programme.title: Beethoven's Ninth at the Proms
programme.desc: Ryan Wigglesworth conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in Beethoven's Ninth Symphony in D minor, 'Choral' - with its famous Ode to Joy finale - at the Royal Albert Hall. The orchestra is joined by the BBC Symphony Chorus and a team of Scottish soloists - soprano Eleanor Dennis, mezzo Karen Cargill, tenor Nicky Spence and bass-baritone Michael Mofidian - for this mighty musical tour-de-force

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Classic 1970s documentary examining the social and intellectual evolution of the human race. Dr Jacob Bronowski begins in Africa's Great Rift Valley, where he traces the evolution of man's unique gifts - foresight and imagination. First shown in 1973

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Dr Jacob Bronowski's account of the social and intellectual evolution of the human race looks at the move mankind made from a nomadic lifestyle to settled agriculture, with the domestication of the horse and the cultivation of wheat. First shown in 1973

programme.title: Being Beethoven
programme.desc: A look at how the composer's return to the town of Heiligenstadt led to one of the most extraordinary outpourings of creativity in the history of music, from the earth-shattering Eroica through to Symphony No 7, while his repeated failed attempts to find love resulted in the famous Immortal Beloved letter found after his death

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of how a cute cartoon character became an international hate symbol after being hijacked by the alt-right, following Pepe's creator Matt Furie as he fights to bring back his lovable comic-book character from the dark forces who stole him

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the Great Plains - 500,000-square miles of flat, treeless grassland - became the setting for some of the Wild West's most dramatic events. Ray joins members of the Blackfeet Nation as they demonstrate bare-back riding skills before undertaking a ritual buffalo hunt and sacrifice. At a cattle auction in Dodge City, Kansas, he reveals stories about the railways and cow-towns before learning about the life of an iconic figure - the cowboy

programme.title: Being Beethoven
programme.desc: A profile of Ludwig van Beethoven, beginning by exploring his childhood, and his subsequent rise to fame as a piano virtuoso, then composer, in late 18th-century Vienna. Featuring Mark Padmore singing one of Beethoven's early lieder Adelaide, and conductor Marin Alsop talking about the premiere of the Ninth Symphony

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels around the British Isles by train, immersing himself in the magnificent scenery of the nation's coastal regions. Meeting locals, he discovers passion and pride in their history, culture and identity, and seeks to understand the challenges each region faces today. He begins at Siccar Point in Berwickshire, which was the site of an extraordinary 18th-century discovery and is a place of pilgrimage for earth scientists from across the world

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how vertebrates capture and devour their food, looking at adaptations in their skeletons that help them eat. The presenter examines the jaws of a sperm whale, finds out which animal has teeth that weigh 5kg each, and reveals which creature uses its skull as a suction pump

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Historian and museum curator Sona Datta explores the story of the Indian subcontinent told through its people, places and dynasties, and looking at their effect on the modern world. She begins by investigating Pakistan's intriguing multicultural past, which also produced some extraordinary and little-known works of art

programme.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
programme.desc: Drama-documentary examining the death of banker Thomas Briggs in July 1864, which was the first murder to be committed on a British train. The film uses testimonies from court transcripts, memoirs, letters and newspaper reports to tell the story of the crime through those connected to it, including engine driver Alfred Ekin - who found the body - and Richard Tanner, the detective in charge of the investigation. It also explores the huge public outcry and debate it provoked. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Naples '44
programme.desc: A portrait of the city at the end of the Second World War, using British intelligence operative Norman Lewis' first-hand accounts, read by Benedict Cumberbatch. They describe a city devastated by Fascism, bombings, Nazi occupation and the Allied invasion, combined with archive footage of Naples in later years, as life returned to the city

programme.title: Colouring Light: Brian Clarke - An Artist Apart
programme.desc: A profile of the Oldham-born painter and stained-glass artist, whose creations have featured in buildings by architects including Norman Foster and Arata Isozaki. He returns to Lancashire, where he recalls his working-class upbringing, and tells the story of his rise to international fame. The film features many of his most famous works, as well as contributions by art historian Martin Harrison and architects Zaha Hadid and Peter Cook

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Classic 1970s documentary examining the social and intellectual evolution of the human race. Dr Jacob Bronowski begins in Africa's Great Rift Valley, where he traces the evolution of man's unique gifts - foresight and imagination. First shown in 1973

Now she embraces her beautiful bald look, but sometimes chooses to wear a wig. With the support of her twin brother and family we take a look into her life. programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Introducing the long 'U' sounds, including the worlds blue, glue and rescue

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and Norman are identifying the birds singing in the forest and hear a strange sound. It’s their broken cuckoo clock. Can the birds help them fix it by finding the missing key?

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: Robert and Justin get their hands on a magical wishing wand from Mac's backpack, but their wishes quickly spiral out of control

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Pando has an earworm - and Bing isn't impressed. When Pando can't resist saying its name, Bingly Bangly, Bing knocks Pando's tower over and wants him to go home. However, Flop then helps to fix everything

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Deed encourages a friend to say ‘tiger' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure! We see a stripy tiger, a swimming tiger, a cheeky tiger and Deed even has a tea party with a tiger!

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy monster is having breakfast and sees little objects on the fridge, why do they not fall off? He goes to Okido to find out!

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Green stages a magic show to introduce her new friends Black and White. Learn the difference between light, bright and dark colours with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos visit a beach and watch a boy build sandcastles. He makes more and more sandcastles, and the Twirlywoos decide they want to help

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin Fletcher goes on an outdoor adventure with one of his friends, building a den, meeting an owl, and singing around a campfire

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po needs an extra snooze before waking up for an energetic Tubby Phone Dance. In Tummy Tales, children enjoy acting out the nursery song Sleeping Bunnies

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Babies and their grown-ups play with shakers and enjoy songs and story time together

programme.title: What's in Your Bag
programme.desc: Civil engineer Mimi shows us how she keeps buildings safe by using her clever calliper to measure any cracks.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, it’s tiny Brussels Sprout performing I’m Mighty and proving how great he is.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea chases the Veggies with a giant snowball

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers walk along the beach to go paddling in the sea.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: During a thundery day at school, the monsters discover Meepa is scared of storms. Can they help her conquer her fear using music, drawing and play?

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Rory and Sandy are in the garden looking for hedgehogs. Chantelle meets two hedgehog rescuers

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: When Henry and his family go on a trip to a nearby pond, it’s fishing nets at the ready as they try their hand at a spot of shrimping! It’s not easy as the tiny shrimp are good at hiding. Luckily, Henry comes up with a plan – but will it work? And will they catch any shrimp? Later, it’s Henry who is good at hiding in a family game of hide-and-seek. But will his clever hiding place be discovered?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Marian's gyuveche is made using layers of peppers, tomatoes and feta with an egg on top

programme.title: Maddie, the Home and You
programme.desc: Children's programme.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Animated fun for younger viewers featuring tales of the world's worst puppy who woofs and wags his way into the lives of an unassuming family

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: It's Safari Worlds annual recycling event, and Andy has been busy tidying up and encouraging the guests to recycle their litter

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say ‘orange’, and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see an orange orange, some slices, a tasty one and meet a juicy orange! There’s an orange winning a football match and one spinning all around. The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dee’s friend finally succeeds in saying today’s word.

programme.title: Colourblocks

programme.desc: Today it is raining inside Mr Tumble's house. Meanwhile, Justin and his friends are having lots of fun playing with water and sand

programme.title: My Petsaurus

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Gem and her teams of Swashbucklers try to win her jewels back from pirates Cook, Line and Sinker. Game show for children

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog and the squirrels decide to play hide-and-seek and Duggee finds them all except Roly

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: The rabbit and friends believe there is a mysterious invader in their tunnels, but getting rid of it proves to be difficult with Tommy Brock nearby

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred and Pete find a heavy metal thing buried in the sand on the beach. It’s got little windows in, and as Fred discovers, it’s full of gunky seaweed. But what is it? It’s time to head back to the museum to see what Suzy and Archie make of it. Archie reveals that this object will ‘keep you safe and sound’, while Suzy finds a photo of a friend of hers with a big metal object just like the one Fred and Pete found. She sends them back to the beach to meet him. Fred and Pete arrive on the beach and are startled to see what looks like an alien with a metal object just like theirs, walking up to them. The ‘alien’ is actually Suzy's friend Iain, and he explains that the metal object on his head is a helmet for a very old-fashioned deep sea diving suit. Fred and Pete then wonder what divers do when they’re underwater. Suzy sends them to the other end of the beach to meet Hannah from the Cornish Diving Centre, who tells them about modern diving equipment and how they use it. Hannah invites Fred

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts must help a giant sunfish who can't swim straight, before it hurts other sea creatures and itself

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo commute on the Dad-Train

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world

programme.title: The Gruffalo
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldson's best-selling children's book. It tells the tale of a little mouse who takes a walk through the woods in search of a nut, only to encounter a fox, an owl and a snake who all want to eat him. To escape their clutches, the quick-witted rodent creates an imaginary monster to scare away his attackers - but it turns out to be all too real. Robbie Coltrane heads the voice cast as the Gruffalo, with James Corden as the Mouse and Rob Brydon, John Hurt and Tom Wilkinson as the predators

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and Norman get a visit from a giant T-Rex, and Norman does his best dinosaur roar

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran

Just when JoJo thinks she might not see a dragonfly, one appears! JoJo learns that the pond is home to lots of creatures

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Revival of the classic animation about the adventures of a clan of friendly aliens living on a small blue planet. Michael Palin narrates

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: A jet of water appears next to Igglepiggle and he discovers he can control it by stamping his feet

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: St Helens v Leigh Leopards (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which takes place at Halliwell Jones Stadium in Warrington. Saints defeated Hull FC 32-18 away from home in their quarter-final match, while Leigh progressed to this stage of the competition following a 34-14 victory at York City Knights

programme.title: Clive Sullivan: Rugby League Legend
programme.desc: Football icon Nathan Blake uncovers the incredible story of a Welsh rugby legend - his uncle, Clive Sullivan - who was the first black man to captain Great Britain in any sport. Nathan's journey begins in Cardiff, Clive's hometown, where he discovers that Clive was part of an exodus of gifted black rugby players, who left the city for the north of England. He speaks to fellow former player Terry Michael, who tells us that he felt no option but to move north to continue his playing career, and to an array of former Hull FC and Hull Kingston Rovers players, in a city in which he is still regarded with the highest respect

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans delves into the BBC Wales archive of 1979, a year of protests, Come Dancing and Bonnie Tyler. Highlights include UFO spotting in mid-Wales, swim therapy, communist mayor in the Rhondda and drag racing in a field. Wynne's loyal companion Ginny sleeps through most of it, so misses the farmer who gives up his cows

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway heads to Llandudno to explore the rugged beauty of Great Orme, a giant headland overlooking the Irish Sea. Along the way he visits St Tudno's church and copper mines that date back 4,000 years

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Donna struggles through a relentless run of back-to-back shifts at the ED dealing with challenging cases - but exhaustion starts to take its toll, ending in disaster. Iain offers to help Faith with her recovery, but his proposed solution only drives her away. Sah confesses to Teddy, and Jan regrets her recent actions when she realises the damage it has caused to her relationship with Ffion

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Bosco is reunited with an old friend from prison, but the pressure of touring takes a toll on his mental health. His downward spiral culminates in a disastrous gig when he goes on stage drunk and initiates a serious confrontation with Bulla. The incident is too much for Honey, who starts making alternative plans. Meanwhile, Vita makes a decision she may later come to regret, and discovers a surprising side to her mother when Beres shows her a video of young Aria

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians (2018)
programme.desc: When New York University professor Rachel Chu heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, Nick Young, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family. The problem is they aren't so approving of her, so she attempts to win them over. Blockbusting comedy based on Kevin Kwan's novel, starring Constance Wu, Henry Golding, Gemma Chan and Michelle Yeoh

programme.title: The Bling Ring (2013)
programme.desc: Five teenagers united by an obsession with celebrity steal from the houses of the rich and famous stars they idolise, using the internet to follow their targets' movements. When the police finally catch up with them, the arrest brings a taste of the fame they have craved. Fact-based drama, starring Emma Watson and Israel Broussard

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Netherlands v Portugal (Kick-off 8.30am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group E, held at Dunedin Stadium in New Zealand. The Netherlands were runners-up to USA four years ago in France, while Portugal are making their debut in the tournament. Gabby Logan presents, with analysis from Steph Houghton, Ellen White and Fara Williams, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Anita Asante

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Peterborough, and visits the town's lido to hear about a local legend, the strongman Walter Cornelius. WIth experts Ben Cooper and Gary Pe

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Pam Rhodes embarks on a personal journey from the south coast to the south midlands, to revisit the people, places and pieces of music that have shaped her Christian faith. She meets up with her friend, worship leader Dave Bilbrough, to discuss the importance of pilgrimage in her life and how it helped her at a time of heartbreak and difficulty

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The London Athletics Meet. Live coverage of the 10th meeting of the season, held at London Stadium. The British leg of the Diamond League was held in Birmingham last year, where home favourites Dina Asher-Smith, Keely Hodgkinson, Laura Muir and Matthew Hudson-Smith all claimed victories

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown is in his home county of Kent, helping two sisters to buy a house each. He also meets a family who have been restoring traditional oast houses for four generation

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway visits the Elan Valley in Powys, for a stunning seven-mile circular walk punctuated by dams. He learns how the valley was flooded to supply water to Birmingham, has a go a mountain biking and discovers the part the area played in the Dambusters attack. Dr Erin Lloyd Jones visit the ruins of the ancient abbey at Strata Florida and Jonny Cotsen meets military veterans who have taken up art

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Pizza chefs Jez and Ieuz continue their adventure across Europe in San Sebastian, where they tour the Spanish city's best tabernas sampling pintxos, before heading to Bordeaux

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the aftermath of one of the biggest fires to ever engulf the UK countryside, Joe Crowley and John Craven explore the impact of increasing wildfires. Joe is in the Scottish Highlands to meet people who have been tackling a wildfire that has been burning since May, while John is in Surrey to reveal how nature reserves can be adapted to stop fire in its tracks. Plus, Adam Henson looks at fire safety on a farm

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow is at Stonor Park in Oxfordshire, where finds include a rare group of Indian medals, Florence Nightingale's toolkit and the story of a remarkable female pilot from the Second World War. There is also an intriguing painting by an unknown artist, some computer generated art with a surprisingly high value and a collection of rare pearls from around the world

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Harry is reunited with Stan in the Sahara Desert, but soon finds that the realities of desert combat are very different to what he is used to. In Paris, Henriette is placed in grave danger when she discovers the Gestapo are hunting for her brother, a situation that could jeopardise the Resistance escape route. Lois recovers from her injuries, but the psychological trauma could take longer to fade

programme.title: Braveheart (1995)
programme.desc: Account of the life of medieval Scottish hero William Wallace. After the slaughter of his father and brother, young Wallace is taken in by his uncle, who teaches him how to use not only his brawn but his brain - which he employs to great effect years later when he resolves to drive the English out of Scotland. Oscar-winning historical epic, directed by and starring Mel Gibson. With Patrick McGoohan, Sophie Marceau and Catherine McCormack

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The stories of beat coppers who stumble upon a key piece of evidence and bring a major criminal to justice. A car running a red light leads officers into a chase with an armed criminal, and a suspicious death leads to the discovery of a deadly poison plot. Presented by Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a giraffe whose weight-loss could mean a crisis for the whole herd, while Ben Fogle finds out which eucalyptus leaves koalas like best and Jean Johansson serves up some refreshing fish lollies for the tigers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Dion Dubllin and Tommy Walsh explore properties in Brixton, south London, Chesterton in Staffordshire and Chelmsford, Essex, and ask the buyers about their plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Epsom in Surrey, and hails a hackney cabs to take him across London. The Reds and the Blues are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Businesswoman and Dragons' Den star Sara Davies takes Robson gorge-walking in Teesdale to introduce him to her way of getting close to nature. After overnighting in a shepherd's hut on a cheese farm, Robson heads to nearby Barnard Castle before visiting the nearby Raby country estate

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps an animal-loving house hunter from Oxfordshire to find a village property in Dorset, ideally close to the coast, and also visits a luxury yacht manufacturer

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam are in Stotfold, Bedfordshire, to create a colourful, peaceful retreat for Daniel and Saleha. The couple are both sun worshippers and would like colour and drama incorporated into the design, as well as a water feature, while Saleha has also asked for some nods to her Bangladeshi heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst explore Cumbria in a campervan, picking up a Scots Guards picture, a rare Scottish jug, and some silver jewellery

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Konnie Huq in the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Distraught Keanu desperately seeks ways to get Peggy back but is heartbroken to discover that a legal battle through the Portuguese courts could take years. Stacey plans a romantic rendezvous at the allotments with Martin, only to realise she has double booked with her client. Kathy is fuming at the knowledge Suki will be going on her honeymoon after Rocky lost it in a poker game to Nish, and Howie gives Kim a pep talk

programme.title: BBC Wales Investigates
programme.desc: Charanpreet Khaira goes undercover to investigate how children are being exploited by drugs gangs on social media. She speaks to a victim who tells us how she was groomed online as a teenager, and forced into a world of crime and sex abuse. An ex-gang member also reveals how he was involved in trafficking children as he feared for his life

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: The true picture comes to light when Thames Valley Police open an investigation. The police trawl through evidence and make a connection between Peter's and Ann's symptoms. They have a working hypothesis, but what they desperately need is proof. Evidence starts to pile up and the police soon realise that they could be dealing with a frighteningly complex and calculating criminal mind

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy's dark history surfaces as she and Baba don Halloween masks to gain entry to her old school. Jackson and Lola find evidence that links the pair to the third victim, but will they join the dots in time to save a fourth? Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Ordinary Love (2019)
programme.desc: When loving wife Joan feels a lump in her breast, she and husband Tom attempt to navigate the world of serious illness, including the surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Lisa Barros D'Sa and Glenn Leyburn's critically acclaimed drama based on a script by playwright Owen McCafferty, starring Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson and Esh Alladi

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Colombia v Korea Republic (Kick-off 3.00am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group H, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. Colombia last appeared in this tournament in 2015, when they reached the last 16, while the Koreans were eliminated in the group stage four years ago. With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley
