programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the aftermath of one of the biggest fires to ever engulf the UK countryside, Joe Crowley and John Craven explore the impact of increasing wildfires. Joe is in the Scottish Highlands to meet people who have been tackling a wildfire that has been burning since May, while John is in Surrey to reveal how nature reserves can be adapted to stop fire in its tracks. Plus, Adam Henson looks at fire safety on a farm

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow is at Stonor Park in Oxfordshire, where finds include a rare group of Indian medals, Florence Nightingale's toolkit and the story of a remarkable female pilot from the Second World War. There is also an intriguing painting by an unknown artist, some computer generated art with a surprisingly high value and a collection of rare pearls from around the world

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Harry is reunited with Stan in the Sahara Desert, but soon finds that the realities of desert combat are very different to what he is used to. In Paris, Henriette is placed in grave danger when she discovers the Gestapo are hunting for her brother, a situation that could jeopardise the Resistance escape route. Lois recovers from her injuries, but the psychological trauma could take longer to fade

programme.title: Braveheart (1995)
programme.desc: Account of the life of medieval Scottish hero William Wallace. After the slaughter of his father and brother, young Wallace is taken in by his uncle, who teaches him how to use not only his brawn but his brain - which he employs to great effect years later when he resolves to drive the English out of Scotland. Oscar-winning historical epic, directed by and starring Mel Gibson. With Patrick McGoohan, Sophie Marceau and Catherine McCormack

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Distraught Keanu desperately seeks ways to get Peggy back but is heartbroken to discover that a legal battle through the Portuguese courts could take years. Stacey plans a romantic rendezvous at the allotments with Martin, only to realise she has double booked with her client. Kathy is fuming at the knowledge Suki will be going on her honeymoon after Rocky lost it in a poker game to Nish, and Howie gives Kim a pep talk

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: The true picture comes to light when Thames Valley Police open an investigation. The police trawl through evidence and make a connection between Peter's and Ann's symptoms. They have a working hypothesis, but what they desperately need is proof. Evidence starts to pile up and the police soon realise that they could be dealing with a frighteningly complex and calculating criminal mind

programme.desc: When loving wife Joan feels a lump in her breast, she and husband Tom attempt to navigate the world of serious illness, including the surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items. programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to convince everyone that he's not afraid when they visit a spooky new attraction in the Backov Zofar. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the impact of summer in the northern hemisphere and winter in the south, revealing that wildlife faces feast, famine, fire and torrential rain in different regions around the world. On Marion Island life has frozen to a standstill, with king penguin chicks facing starvation as their parents left months ago, while in northern Australia it's the dry season, and hooded parrots raise their chicks in termite mounds

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: Kim Philby begins to understand that the KGB can never fully trust him now that he is in Moscow, and as far as they are concerned his life as a spy for them is over. Back in London, Nicholas Elliot warns Anthony Blunt that his cover has been blown

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The actress continues her journey on the African island of Madagascar, where she discovers the secrets of the world's second most expensive spice, vanilla. She also searches for gold with a poor gold-mining community, and finds out how cacao is used to make some of the world's best chocolate. Later, Joanna travels to the tourist island of Nosy Be, where the men participate in a dangerous martial art called Morengy and the women are paving the way for female equality

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell report on two more cases. More than 40 years ago, Caroline Kinsey was pregnant, alone and unable to provide the kind of family and upbringing she believed all children deserved. Burdened by her heart-breaking decision to give her son up for adoption, Caroline longs to find him, to hear that he did have a happy childhood, and to know whether he can forgive her after all these years. Raised as an only child, Paul McFarlane's beloved mother died when he was nine, but years later, a single piece of paper threw all his assumptions about his small family into question

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.desc: When Daphne takes the rest of the gang to meet her friend, famous voice over actor Frank Welker, they inadvertently find themselves in the middle of a very strange mystery full of several different monsters and several different actors! The gang meets voice over actors Frank Welker, Grey DeLisle-Griffin, Matthew Lillard and Kate Micucci, who have all gathered to do their job of recording an episode of a hit animated show that vaguely seems to be about four teenagers and their talking animal. But, when different monsters show up and start abducting various actors from the group, it looks like our gang has a real mystery on their hands, even more mysterious than how the actors' voices all sound strangely familiar to our gang

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Folks, have ya heard? Your favorite Looney Tunes characters are back in action!

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons

When all three get taken to jail, they attempt to escape while chained together. / Sylvester tries to catch Tweety in his nest on top of a telephone pole. / After Daffy convinces Porky to go skydiving, things get crazy when they jump out of the plane... especially when they realize Daffy forgot the parachutes!

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. A long-clawed feline with a spotted coat and sculpted mask bursts into the Queen's bedroom in the middle of the night and whisks the monarch away as if by magic.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. To retrieve his drone (which he thinks Hammy climbed onto by accident!), Mo requests the power to fly from the Scepter... and yes, he flies! But not the way he wants to: the half power has him drifting through the air like a helium balloon! As he floats above the rooftops on the end of a string held by Lenny, Younes and Owen see what they think is an Alien and launch an operation to capture him...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. A Super Villain called Bad Bzzz - half human/half bumblebee - has chosen Sam and Mo's school as a base... to wrap kids up like cocoons! Brother and sister are astonished: WHOA! They have an authentic, truly evil Super Villain to fight? They're helped by Granny Wanda, who coaches them in essential Super-Hero rules... but eventually, they discover Bad Bzzz's true identity...

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the impact of summer in the northern hemisphere and winter in the south, revealing that wildlife faces feast, famine, fire and torrential rain in different regions around the world. On Marion Island life has frozen to a standstill, with king penguin chicks facing starvation as their parents left months ago, while in northern Australia it's the dry season, and hooded parrots raise their chicks in termite mounds

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: Kim Philby begins to understand that the KGB can never fully trust him now that he is in Moscow, and as far as they are concerned his life as a spy for them is over. Back in London, Nicholas Elliot warns Anthony Blunt that his cover has been blown

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The actress continues her journey on the African island of Madagascar, where she discovers the secrets of the world's second most expensive spice, vanilla. She also searches for gold with a poor gold-mining community, and finds out how cacao is used to make some of the world's best chocolate. Later, Joanna travels to the tourist island of Nosy Be, where the men participate in a dangerous martial art called Morengy and the women are paving the way for female equality

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell report on two more cases. More than 40 years ago, Caroline Kinsey was pregnant, alone and unable to provide the kind of family and upbringing she believed all children deserved. Burdened by her heart-breaking decision to give her son up for adoption, Caroline longs to find him, to hear that he did have a happy childhood, and to know whether he can forgive her after all these years. Raised as an only child, Paul McFarlane's beloved mother died when he was nine, but years later, a single piece of paper threw all his assumptions about his small family into question

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A philandering husband is found dying by the swimming pool after being shot during a house party at the home of Lady Lucy Angkatell. Legendary Belgian Sleuth Poirot, who is guest of honour at the gathering, appears to have an open-and-shut case on his hands - but the investigator finds himself up against one of his finest adversaries. Whodunit, guest-starring Sarah Miles (Ryan's Daughter), with David Suchet, Lysette Anthony and Edward Fox

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: Ma is beside herself and cleaning like a demon for the imminent arrival of her sister Bertha and her husband and daughter, suburbanites who despise the countryside - and in particular dirt and animals. Meanwhile, Tom's plans for Bluff Court are speeding ahead, but threats of pulling down Spreading Linda and flattening the countryside are worrying Miss Pilchester and other villagers

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: The actress begins her journey along the ancient trade route, travelling thousands of miles across eight countries. She begins in Venice, Italy, where she sees how the travels of Silk Road traders influenced the growth of the small island state. She then travels to Albania and walks the beginning of the Via Egnatia, before reaching Turkey, where she uncovers centuries of trading and travelling history

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The last-ever episode. When his colleague Hilda Pierce is targeted by an assassin outside MI5, Foyle must re-examine her top-secret role during the war. He suspects the shooting could be connected to the hunt for a traitor within the Special Operations Executive who may have been behind the deaths of nine agents in France. Meanwhile, Sam is faced with a dilemma when Adam and Glenvil crack down on the black market in East Peckham. Guest stars include Conleth Hill (Game of Thrones' Lord Varys)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Brenda Blethyn. The detective investigates a fire that rips through a holiday park on the Northumberland coast, destroying three cabins. A young woman's body is discovered and the resort's owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: The aftermath of the Titanic disaster causes conflict within the household, as Miss Forrest gradually assumes more responsibility - and no one is more incensed than Lady Bellamy's personal maid, who escaped the tragedy on a life-raft

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient who set fire to his own shop (guest star Tony Slattery) attempts to avoid police questioning by leaping into an ambulance and driving off towards the pier - unaware Alun and a sick man are in the back of the vehicle. Meanwhile, Dr Makori fears for her relationship with Dr Fox when he tells her he has been offered a job in Biafra. Medical drama, with Andy Wear, Paul Fox and Kananu Kirimi

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A wedding reception held on Elsinby Pier ends in tragedy when a fishing trawler sails badly off course. Meanwhile, Adam faces up to a tough decision and the staff at the hospital prepare for a new arrival as Jill goes into labour. Robert Cavanah and Amy Robbins star

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: The prospect of a weekend in Edinburgh with Veronica leads Simon and Oliver to swear they adore opera. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: A gleeful Simon learns Oliver's shop has been burgled - but is forced to pay for his lack of sympathy when he needs a favour from his rival. Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rodney gives Pollard a friendly warning, while Steph packs her bags and storms out, loudly declaring she would rather die than stay a minute longer

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel blurts out her true feelings to Ashley, while Diane broaches the painful subject of Daz with Andy, and the Dingles' plans to throw a surprise party for Cain are ruined

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The past finally catches up with the Nelson family

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As the Morgan brothers sit in wait for Angela, they make Katy suffer by denying the terrified girl her insulin. Luckily, Kevin realises something is wrong and calls in the police

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Like many good men before them, the feuding fathers fall out over a woman. Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden star

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Though they may not seem like the world's best role models, Oliver and Simon are called on to offer fatherly advice. Comedy, starring Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: After finding out about the hospital's staffing problems, Jill offers to cut short her maternity leave and return to work, while Matron notices that Catherine is doing her best to avoid Adam. Out in Africa, Jeff faces the horrors of war and makes a promise to a dying woman - but faces difficulties in keeping his word

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Goodwin returns from Africa with Biafran orphan Nkeshi, and shocks his colleagues when they realise he has smuggled the child into the country illegally. The presence of an unhappy celebrity causes a paparazzi furore, and nearly costs Frankie his job. Dr Weatherill deals with an uncooperative alcoholic on her first day back at work. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Heartbroken Laurel accepts a post as an au pair in Finland, Debbie lands herself in more hot water and Daz gives Andy cause for concern

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert pleads with Katie not to marry Andy, and Viv spills red wine down the wedding dress, while Nicola tries to persuade Ashley he's making the biggest mistake of his life

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As armed police storm the Nelsons' house, the Morgan brothers make a desperate bid for freedom, while Katy and Tommy lie unconscious on the floor

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Katy confesses to her furious mother that she is to blame for leading the Morgans to their door, prompting Angela to make a life-changing decision for her family

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Another chance to see the feature-length first episode of the popular detective drama. Inspector Jack Frost's investigation into the case of a missing child uncovers a skeleton chained to a locked strongbox that tantalisingly turns out to be empty, but provides evidence of a crime committed 30 years previously. David Jason stars as the irascible detective, with Bruce Alexander, Matt Bardock and Claire Hackett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibley's son during the pursuit. The boy's father demands compensation, but soon realises his problems have just begun as his daughter reveals she is pregnant. Steve finds himself in trouble and David invents a novel way to rid the estate of moles. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon, James Carlton and Ted Robbins

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A recently widowed woman arrives in Aidensfield wanting to bury her husband in the family grave, but the deceased's brother refuses to co-operate because of an old feud. Vernon and David get involved and find themselves held at gunpoint as a shocking case of fraud is uncovered. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective investigates the disappearance of a Dutch au pair, which seems connected to rivalry amid the city's academics. His search leads him to a family estate in the Oxfordshire countryside where he meets three siblings divided by personal demons and shared loss. Endeavour suspects there is a link between the disappearance and an unsolved case from years before, but as the investigation continues, conflict erupts between his fellow officers. When a group of teenagers makes a horrifying discovery, he suspects someone is manipulating events from afar

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a toddler goes missing from a high-street merry-go-round, his distraught mother reports him kidnapped and a massive police hunt is launched to track him down. However, with more than one suspect and no physical evidence, the search throws up more questions than answers - especially as the boy's mum seems to be hiding something. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar as detectives investigating a cold-case killing from almost 40 years earlier. The discovery of a skeleton in the cellar of a demolished building launches a murder hunt, headed up by DCI Cassie Stuart and DS Sunny Khan. However, all they have to go on is a car key found near the body, which leads them on a search to find out who he is, as well as how, when and why he died. WithTom Courtenay, Trevor Eve, Bernard Hill, Ruth Sheen, Gemma Jones and Hannah Gordon

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The holiday hosts meet one last time, to settle the scores and discover what they've been paid. First to face the music is Pete Storey and his partner Alex Muse, owners of the George Inn in Barton-upon-Humber, Lincolnshire. After dishing out some flooring feedback, a payment leaves Phil and Maria out in the cold. Dirty discoveries, the utter lack of praise and sleep problems are all on the agenda, alongside the continental breakfast. After some dramatic discoveries and frank exchanges, the winning host is finally announced

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: North Wales couple Rebecca and Carl want to find their very own bolthole in Gandia, Valencia, that will start as a holiday home but one day become a permanent home. With their children now grown up, they feel now is the right time to make the move. Ideally, they want enough land to grow their own fruit and veg and to be near the beach, so Rebecca can collect shells and stones that inspire her craft jewellery business. Armed with a budget of £80,000, Jean Johansson shows them five properties for them to consider

programme.title: Gregg Wallace: The British Miracle Meat
programme.desc: The MasterChef presenter goes behind the scenes on the creation of a new lab-grown meat substitute, exploring the technology behind its creation and claims that it could substantially help people through the cost-of-living crisis. Gregg then heads to Michelin-starred restaurant Le Gavroche to conduct a taste test with celebrity chef Michel Roux Jr, while Michelle Ackerley visits Borough Market with a plate of samples to hear what people make of the taste and origin of this intriguing new protein

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Other patients include a 22-year-old professional carer who has been brought into A&E after collapsing at work and a man who trapped his finger in a container. Plus, nurse Jess talks about her stammer

programme.title: The Unique Boutique
programme.desc: A team of disabled fashion designers create new looks for people of all body shapes. In this first episode, they create a dress that won't snag on wheelchair wheels, develop a whole new wardrobe for a cancer patient who has found few of her old clothes fit her new body shape, and come up with a confidence-inspiring new look for a separated father looking to rekindle his love life

programme.title: Dr Death

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete in south-east London, where the rivals are all planning to serve lamb. Other highlights include wedding bells and a musical turn from one of the hosts

programme.title: Miriam and Alan: Lost in Scotland and Beyond
programme.desc: Actors Miriam Margolyes and Alan Cumming continue their motorhome adventure to rediscover their Scottish roots. Alan reveals he is on the hunt for a home to retire to as a showbiz recluse, but he is put off by the midges, so while he does a spot of house-hunting, Miriam goes all scientific to find a repellent for his tiny problem. The duo also record a song in the Gaelic language, with Miriam trying - and failing - to provide the percussion, take part in the Glencoe uphill mountain race and meet a pagan witch, who involves them in an ancient healing ritual

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and sketch comedian Doon Mackichan visit Donegal in the Republic of Ireland to see what it has to offer. Their first stop is at Tuath na Mara which boasts access to a secluded sandy cove, perfect for outdoor swimming enthusiast Doon. Sandi shares a personal confession and the pair go for an icy dip in the North Atlantic. Next, the duo stay at the eco-resort Lough Mardal Lodge where they meet miniature cows and share stories of Mongolian princesses. They end their adventure in the countryside just north of Donegal Bay where they stay in Candlewick Cottage in which Doon serenades Sandi with improvised comedy tunes on the piano

programme.title: Sue Perkins' Big American Road Trip
programme.desc: Part one of two. The presenter travels across California and Colorado in a campervan, beginning with a journey along the Pacific Coast Highway to Yosemite. Along the way, she meets people who have given up a settled existence in favour of living in campervans, including one of the stars of Oscar-winning film Nomadland, who brings the whole idea of nomadic living to a brand-new audience via his YouTube channel

Yoga teacher Venessa and son Jacob try to assess whether there is a bond between them and Zoe, a friendly beagle who has been trying to sniff out a new home for a while. programme.desc: During a dramatic pursuit, Faulko is rammed off the road at 80mph and has to be rushed to hospital, while the team battles to tackle the aftermath of the crash, and track down the driver responsible. programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Tracy Borman goes in search of the lost royal palace of Henry VIII, a sumptuous group of royal buildings that were once part of the Tower. The lovesick king spent a fortune on building them to celebrate his marriage to Anne Boleyn, only to destroy all memories of her after her execution

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Chief curator Tracy Borman delves into the Duke of Wellington's history, and discovers how he reinvented the place when he became Constable of the Tower, reforming the Yeoman Warders to wipe out corruption, and strengthening the Tower as a military stronghold with the construction of a barracks named after his victory at Waterloo. However, during Wellington's time as Constable, the Tower came close to total destruction as a terrible fire tore through one of its most vital buildings, a huge armoury called the Grand Storehouse

programme.title: Elizabeth I: The Golden Era
programme.desc: Docudrama starring Lily Cole as the young queen, featuring reconstructions of key moments in her life. Presented by historians Suzannah Lipscomb and Dan Jones. The programme explores how an ambitious nobleman plotted to use her to seize the throne for himself, and how she faced execution at her sister's order before her coronation in 1558

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: A retired teacher who has written two guidebooks about dog-friendly campsites with good walks nearby heads out in her 20-year-old motorhome to do research for a possible third book. At the exclusive Prevost Expo Show in Florida the RVs on display cost on average £800,000, and a couple visiting the show in their own home on wheels are given a quick tour inside before they head off on their next adventure

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: Police arrest a woman who is on a rampage with a hammer, but when another family member turns up and starts abusing officers, they are faced with a potentially violent situation. programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: A South Wales officer is bitten on the finger while trying to make an arrest, while new policewoman finds herself separated from her colleague and facing an angry young man - who decides to attack her. In south London, two Metropolitan Police officers respond to a 999 call and PC Gray climbs into a dark room through a broken window and soon finds himself facing a man who is armed with a shovel

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: The history of the prison, which has been used to incarcerate everyone from serial killers Ian Brady and Peter Sutcliffe to rock stars Pete Doherty and Keith Richards. The programme examines its use by MI5 in the Second World War, the story of a Soviet spy who escaped, and perhaps the most well-known inmate, the infamous Charles Bronson

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: A stunning journey in New Zealand, through the heart of South Island's best scenery. It starts in Greymouth, renowned for its coal mining past, moving on to Arthur's Pass National Park - with its historically important Maori hunting grounds. The train passes through Cass, made famous by Kiwi artist Rita Angus and onwards to the Waimakiriri gorge and its 15 tunnels and four viaducts. Rail engineers recall how the line has been affected by earthquakes before the journey arrives in Christchurch, a city sitting on a volcano. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: The Funny Thing About
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas is joined by celebrities and comedians for a talking heads show combining observational comedy, confessions and anecdotes. programme.title: Police Interceptors

In Bulwell, a man calls police claiming to have had his hire car stolen, and Paul Charlesworth and Toby Hardy manage to track the missing car down and find a stepdad and daughter, who are suspected of drug driving and drug possession respectively.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Officers a hunt for a car linked to an Albanian organised crime gang, which leads to large quantities of drugs found concealed inside the body of the vehicle. A sinister hooded man is reported behaving threateningly towards young women, and police also intervene in a family dispute as a father worries about a young man his daughter has met

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: A team responds to a hit-and-run involving a cyclist, with medical support for the victim taking place alongside police investigation into the identity of the driver. Paramedic Nathan and special sergeant Hannah respond to a 16-year-old boy has started fitting. They need to make sure he doesn't come to any harm before rushing him to hospital

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Matthew is rushed into hospital after a collision between his motorbike and a tractor. His chest has taken the full force of the impact but there could be other, hidden injuries. Trauma Team Leader Mark Poulson desperately needs to assess all the damage before Matthew's condition deteriorates further

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The knife crime team stops a driver with a boot containing a box full of cannabis, which leads to a search of his house where police also find a cannabis grow in the loft. Elsewhere, Rob and Dan are in the right place at the right time when a drunk driver crashes right behind them

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: A look at customised luxury cars, including a supercar superfan, whose collection includes one of only 100 Aston Martin Vantages in the world, as well as Mercedes, and Audi and three Morgans. Self-made millionaire Scott heads off to order a third Lamborghini from their range of luxury cars, while at a Porsche track day, owners get the chance to try out new models and put them to the test

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Secret Italy
programme.desc: Alex embarks on a voyage of discovery back to her roots as she revisits some of the places that have special memories for her as well as exploring some of the country's little-known treasures. She begins with a tour of northern Italy to uncover some of its hidden secrets including a prison in Venice with a difference and ventures to a gem in Lombard Alps, before taking in the fashionable sights that Italy's capital of cool Milan has to offer - here she gets the chance to admire some of opera singer Maria Callas's unforgettable stage costumes

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice presents a compilation of advice from past episodes, visiting an Edinburgh home suffering from a surfeit of personality, a Victorian residence in Chester that needs restoring to its former glory and a Derbyshire cottage with rather too many stuffed animals for its own good

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: To find out more about England, Milkshake! Monkey goes on a London bus tour and tries some traditional food

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Chicaletta goes missing on Chicken Day and the PAW Patrol has to find her to save the festivities

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan (1984)
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Monster Trucks (2016)
programme.desc: A drilling operation unleashes a subterranean creature which feeds on oil. The monster bonds with a monster truck which a local teenager is building from spare parts, and the youngster befriends the beast and helps it to return to its underground home. Fantasy adventure, starring Lucas Till and Jane Levy

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Jingle All the Way (1996)
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence (2016)
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Gemini Man (2019)
programme.desc: An aging assassin is targeted by a mysterious young operative that seems able to anticipate his every move. Discovering that he's being hunted by a younger clone of himself, Henry needs to find out why he's being targeted and who the creator is. Action drama, starring Will Smith, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Clive Owen

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin (2021)
programme.desc: Margot, a young woman who was abandoned by her mother as a baby, travels to a secluded Amish community with a documentary film crew seeking answers about her mother and extended family. Horror thriller, starring Emily Bader, Roland Buck III and Dan Lippert

programme.title: The Vigil (2019)
programme.desc: In Jewish law, a shomer is a person who agrees to watch over the body of a recently deceased member of the community. Yakov, who has stepped away from his Hasidic roots following the death of his younger brother, is asked to act as an overnight shomer for Holocaust survivor Mr Litvak. The deceased's wife is in the grip of dementia and is unfit to stand vigil over Mr Litvak. Yakov accepts this important role and prepares for a long night of quiet contemplation. Thriller, starring Dave Davis and Menashe Lustig

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth (1959)
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro (2005)
programme.desc: The masked hero investigates a mysterious explosion linked to a French count, who is plotting to prevent California joining the United States - and discovers his wife, who walked out on their marriage when he refused to hang up his sword, is somehow involved. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Antonio Banderas, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Rufus Sewell, Alberto Reyes and Adrian Alonso

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977)
programme.desc: An electrical repairman sees a fleet of UFOs and develops an increasing fascination with mountain-shaped forms, driving his wife to despair. Meanwhile, another woman has a similar fixation after her son mysteriously vanishes, and a team of scientists investigates a series of strange events around the world. Eventually, they are all drawn to a mountain where aliens are about to make contact. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Francois Truffaut and Teri Garr

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel (2019)
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguez's Sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Downhill (2020)
programme.desc: After believing they are about to be killed by an avalanche during a family ski vacation in Austria, married couple Billie and Pete Stanton are forced to re-evaluate their lives and how they feel about each other. Directors Nat Faxon and Jim Rash's remake of Swedish comedy drama Force Majeure, starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Will Ferrell and Miranda Otto

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky (2019)
programme.desc: Astronaut Lucy Cola is left stunned by her first space mission. Upon returning to Earth, she feels disconnected from her normal life with her husband and niece. Although required to undergo NASA therapy and recommended to rest, Lucy begins pushing herself mentally and physically so she can return to space on the next available mission. Co-writer/director Noah Hawley drama, starring Natalie Portman, Jon Hamm and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Coffee Morning Club
programme.desc: The members of the Deaf Club await their fate in holding cells at the police station

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie (2004)
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: Little Monsters (1989)
programme.desc: Brian is a lonely 11-year-old who's just moved to Boston with his family. He's having a hard time making friends in his new neighbourhood, and to make matters worse, he wakes up one morning to find he's being blamed for a stack of pranks that he swears he hasn't done. However, a blue-skinned monster called Maurice soon changes his life forever. Comedy, starring Fred Savage, Howie Mandel and Daniel Stern

programme.title: Anne of the Indies (1951)
programme.desc: A no-nonsense pirate welcomes a French captain on board her ship and promptly falls in love - unaware the charming officer has been sent by the British to capture her. Learning of the deception, she kidnaps his wife to sell as a slave. Jacques Tourneur's high-seas adventure, starring Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget and Herbert Marshall

programme.title: The Pink Panther (1963)
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum (2019)
programme.desc: The seemingly invincible hero returns, this time with a $14million bounty on his head which rises each hour, and every underworld figure around the world desperate to cash in. However, John Wick does receive support from Sofia, a fellow dog lover, assassin and manager of Casablanca's Continental Hotel. Director Chad Stahelski's action thriller sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Halle Berry and Ian McShane

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: To avenge her mother's death, a young woman named Pixie masterminds a heist but must flee across Ireland from gangsters, take on the patriarchy, and choose her own destiny along the way. Crime comedy, starring Olivia Cooke, Fra Fee and Rory Fleck Byrne

programme.title: Skate Kitchen (2018)
programme.desc: Teenage skateboarder Camille's life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a bunch of other skateboarding girls in New York City. As she journeys deeper into the city's subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship. Drama, starring Rachelle Vinberg, Dede Lovelace and Nina Moran

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jenna could be in for a scary surprise as her fiance Nathan is planning a Mexican Day of the Dead-themed wedding for their big day

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Reece, who is ex-military, plans an army-themed wedding with a twist. However, his fiancee Lucy has dreams of getting married in a castle. It therefore remains to be seen whether he will win her over with his military manoeuvres - or instead receive his marching orders

programme.title: Barnyard (2006)
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he tried to save - Handlebar, Casa Roma and the Black Pearl - to find out whether his advice has been put to good use

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to teach his son a lesson in responsibility by stealing his unlocked bike - but ends up taking the wrong one. Elsewhere, Mitchell and Cameron decide to introduce Lily to other children and arrange a play date, while Jay tries to bond with Manny

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny takes time out to play with Luke, before having a heart-to-heart with stepsister Claire. Gloria goes shopping for a dress with Alex, and Phil urges Jay to fly his new model aeroplane with him. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell's mother tries to make amends for the incident at Jay and Gloria's wedding but no one is happy to see her, and the whole family has dinner at Claire's house. American comedy, guest starring Shelley Long

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The family goes to Gloria and Jay's house for a barbecue and to watch the football, but an incident at school involving Manny and Luke creates tension between Claire and her host. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The first day of school arrives and Phil misreads how Claire is coping with an empty house, while Jay and Gloria disagree over what Manny should wear. Mitchell and Cameron are very upset when Lily gets a bump to the head. Starring Ed O'Neill (Married with Children) and Julie Bowen (Boston Legal)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: George Sr bails Meemaw and Georgie out of jail, Sheldon and Missy meet Mandy, and Mary feels unwelcome at church. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Missy and Sheldon try to help out with the Cooper family's financial troubles, while Mary struggles to deal with life outside the church. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is awarded a prestigious prize by the university, but is scared of collecting the gong at a ceremony because he knows he'll have to give a speech. Penny tries to gee him up with rousing references to X-Men, and Leonard and Raj offer psychological guidance - without much success

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tells Penny he loves her, but fails to get the response he would have liked. Sheldon also finds himself competing against Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Wil Wheaton once again when the gang goes bowling - and tries to get his revenge

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to hide the fact he had dinner with Penny after she broke up with Leonard, hoping to stay friends with her. However, keeping secrets does not prove to be his strong point, and it isn't long before his deceit is exposed. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire (1993)
programme.desc: A struggling actor's ambitious, no-nonsense wife throws him out and demands a divorce. Desperate to spend time with his children, he puts his talents to good use by donning drag and posing as a British housekeeper to get a job looking after them - unaware of the positive impact the character will have on his life and career. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein and Mara Wilson

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Le Bistro in Lighthouse Point, Florida, where the stubborn chef and owner has lost his passion for cooking. The visiting expert hopes to help, but his criticisms are not well received, causing tempers to flare

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: A new face causes Sienna more trouble than first expected, John Paul is injured in a homophobic attack at the Loft and Cindy is hospitalised as her mental health struggles continue

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to teach his son a lesson in responsibility by stealing his unlocked bike - but ends up taking the wrong one. Elsewhere, Mitchell and Cameron decide to introduce Lily to other children and arrange a play date, while Jay tries to bond with Manny

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey's Spanish Pavillion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eatery's fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for West Babylon, New York, to help the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts. The chef struggles to cope with disorganised staff and an unappealing menu, but quickly realises the real problem lies in the kitchen, where a lack of leadership and communication is causing serious trouble

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen

programme.title: Charlotte's Web (2006)
programme.desc: Youngster Fern tries to persuade her father to keep the runt of a litter when a sow gives birth to piglets on the family farm. While the little pig still looks destined for the chop, clever spider Charlotte hatches a plan to use her web-spinning talents to save him. Family drama, starring Dakota Fanning and featuring the voices of Julia Roberts, Dominic Scott Kay, Steve Buscemi and John Cleese

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon invites a famous physicist to the flat after befriending her online, but is put out to find Leonard showing an interest in her. Meanwhile, Penny has to confront her ex-boyfriend when the visitor turns up in his bedroom. Guest starring Judy Greer (Glenn Martin, DDS)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The comedy flashes back to reveal how Sheldon saved the lives of his pals, and looks at the origins of his friendship with Leonard seven years previously, as well as explaining the housemates' agreement. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj and Howard register Sheldon with an online dating site hoping to find his perfect female equivalent. Meanwhile, a drunk Penny seduces Leonard, but regrets it the next day. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to extend his lifespan, concerned he will not be around long enough for his consciousness to be downloaded into a robot body, and the friends encounter Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak (guest starring as himself) at the Cheesecake Factory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon breaks up with Amy and turns to cats in his search for an alternative to human companionship. However, when he starts to bulk-buy pets, Leonard decides enough is enough and calls for reinforcements to help bring his friend back to his senses. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Ordinary New Yorker Matt starts dating a woman he meets on the subway, unaware she is the superhero G-Girl. When he breaks up with the insecure crimefighter, she is outraged and uses her superpowers to make his life a misery. Meanwhile, her arch-enemy sees Matt as a potential ally in defeating G-Girl once and for all. Fantasy comedy, starring Uma Thurman, Luke Wilson and Eddie Izzard

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Mary tries her hand at writing, Mandy needs a new place to live and Sheldon must choose sides in an ethical dilemma. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon

His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show with a difference, in which another two singletons take their pick of potential partners based purely on their naked bodies. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Maggie and Alistair from Edinburgh dream of buying a holiday home on the southern coast of Gran Canari, famous for its famous white sandy beaches. Jasmine Harman shows Maggie and Alistair five potential properties, but will any of them prove to be their dream holiday home?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Amando and Vanessa from the West Midlands find a holiday home in Tenerife, tracking down five properties within their budget of £185,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ravin and Pritti from Surrey want to sell up in the UK and find a new permanent home for themselves and their extended family in Gran Canaria. They've visited neighbouring Canary Islands such as Tenerife and Lanzarote before but never Gran Canaria, and after extensive research have decided that it's where they want to be. They have £180,000 for the big move. Jean Johansson lines up five properties for the duo to consider

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the first of the challenges in chocolate week, Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles task the four remaining teams with making 24 chocolate-domed figurines and 24 desserts. For the showpiece challenge, the teams must create 48 chocolate bars, presented within a dramatic chocolate showpiece inspired by archaeology and featuring a moving part. Judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden are looking for a tall, beautiful and technically precise creation that is good enough to win a team a spot in the next stage of the competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Grange Farm Park in Maltby le Marsh, Lincolnshire, which is run by mum and daughter team Ann Graves and Rebecca O'Brien. Guests Emily and Warren marvel at their luxury room, while father and son Bis and Deep can't wait to dive into their hot tub. But Marilyn and Neil are concerned that their bathroom might be a bit cramped. After a day out feeding baby seals at a local seal sanctuary, the B&Bers congregate at the on-site restaurant for dinner, where Marilyn isn't pleased to find out that she and Neil are the only guests without a hot tub

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Marilyn and Neil Tuson host the second night of the week at Edgecliff Boutique B&B in Birchington-on-Sea, Kent - hoping the breathtaking views will give them the edge they need. Guests Emily and Warren are big fans of their room's sea views, but Bis and Deep find a dirty kettle and Ann and Rebecca aren't happy about a dusty chandelier. Later, in the morning, there's a long wait at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Vera's Kitchen and B&B in Lechlade, Gloucestershire, where young owners Warren Neinaber and Emily Mapson hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in to the Preston Hotel in Yeovil, owned by father and son Bis and Deep Oozageer. Ann and Rebecca find their room more cheap than cheerful, although an afternoon tasting the produce at a cider brandy distillery proves a massive hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners reunite, ready to air their grievances from throughout the week. Ann and Rebecca from Grange Farm Park aren't happy with Marilyn marking them down for the lack of a hot tub, and Marilyn herself isn't too pleased when her and Neil review the feedback for their slow breakfast service at Edgecliff Boutique B&B

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the £1,000 prize. But she's worried about being in the firing line, after Rosie compared Muneer's food to vomit on the first night. Now Moony's determined to give Rosie a public dressing down. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. And after laid-back Muneer and critical Rosie seem to have put their tension behind them at Christine's, Ben's determined to take things up a notch as he entertains his guests with his amazing body art, cooking skills and pet crabs

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fridge salesman Gregory serves up a Spanish menu in Peterborough, accompanied by a charm offensive that he hopes will win him the £1,000 prize. Will it work or will the guests give him the cold shoulder?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fiery Brazilian Rosie is confident that her night will be the best of the week in Peterborough. After Gregory used packet mixes, Rosie is determined to show him how to throw a dinner party by making everything from scratch. She's ruffled a few feathers throughout the week with her brutally honest critiques, and her guests, roused for retribution, scour every element of her Brazilian night for any faults, from her samba dancers to her authentic pig-ear stew

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Compilation of highlights from the documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, including a couple having to choose between a French bulldog and a nervous terrier, a jack russell finding a family that need a dog able to keep up with them, and a dog offering to pull his prospective owner's wheelchair along

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: A mother and son must choose between a stray westie and a young Staffie cross. Plus, a nine-year-old client comes in with a long list of exactly what he wants in a dog

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: The host travels to Saudi Arabia and Jordan, and visits the iconic sites and undiscovered jewels that are only just becoming accessible to tourists. From the natural beauty of the Red Sea, with its outstanding corals and marine life, to the ancient rock art and desert camps of local Bedouin tribes, testament to humanity's connection to this awe-inspiring landscape over millennia

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Katie is rushed to St George's by helicopter after a riding accident. The 46-year-old's horse has fallen on top of her, resulting in multiple broken bones and internal injuries. Amy has a deep laceration to her ankle after a party with her flatmates ended with her falling onto a gin glass, and Pamela has suffered a sudden bout of back pain, leaving her in agony

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff at St George's Hospital in south-west London treat patients from three different generations. Leo is in A&E after crashing his car and flipping it on its roof. Leo's husband JR tells the story of how the two men met and how some members of their family struggled to accept their marriage. Meanwhile, young Kieran has hurt his wrist tumbling off his skateboard and 91-year-old Lillian has fallen over at home

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Another selection of favourite investigations, with Jimmy Doherty heading to South Africa on the trail of sweet piquante peppers and visits the company that has exclusive rights to grow, process and market these colourful chillies. Kate Quilton is in Hawaii to investigate the potentially dangerous levels of mercury in tuna, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why the bags of ice cubes in supermarkets are so crystal clear

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: In Cumbria, the architect meets Harry, who wants to take a derelict Victorian railway signal box and turn it into a garden summerhouse for his home, while in Derby, 22-year-old wood carver Sophie hopes to transform a campervan into a mobile home and showroom to use to sell her wares at festivals. On his Italian road trip, George discovers a spectacular house made almost entirely out of glass near Lake Lugano, and at the wilderness retreat, he and Will struggle to get the walls right

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George challenges innovative architect Greg Blee with transforming an impractical, upside down house with a mishmash of living spaces for Martijn and Sally. The building is so badly laid out that to get from the kitchen to the garden you must go through the master bedroom, but can Greg create a design that works on Martyn and Sally's budget of £65,000?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke meets Pip, a woman in West Yorkshire who is moving back into her childhood home, which was last decorated by her parents in the 1960s. Pip struggles with the idea of painting over her childhood wallpaper and replacing the kitchen that her father hand built, but George is on hand to offer her emotional support

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nursing manager Sarah hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, taking inspiration from her husband's Middle Eastern heritage to offer her guests a Turkish fusion menu. Joining her is 28-year-old painter decorator Alex, 45-year-old bridal shop owner Abbi, 60-year-old community centre manager Janet and 56-year-old record label boss Phil. A hilarious evening lies in store, with unexpected tattoos, beauty tips and twerking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Would-be clairvoyant Janet hosts the second of a week of dinner parties in Leeds and hopes her ghoul-themed dinner party will help her win the cash prize. Part of Janet's plan is to pretend her house is haunted and she has a practical joke lined up for nursing manager Sarah and bridal shop owner Abbi to find. With more surprises in store, will the fright-night theme be enough to ghost Janet into the lead?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Record label owner Phil hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, hoping to win the £1,000 prize money by serving up a 1970s rock-themed menu. His guests are astounded by his mystery past, and painter and decorator Alex is unimpressed when wedding shop owner Abbi continues to wind him up

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Abbi continues to belittle the host - until he reveals he spends his evenings on stage impersonating a famous heart-throb singer. Will his performance bag him the top prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bridal shop owner Abbi hopes to woo her guests with a wedding-themed party on the final day of the competition in Leeds. Will the tension take over, or can the wedding theme create an amorous atmosphere that will help Abbi win the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Castle Arms Inn in Snape, North Yorkshire, where owner Jill Chinnery hopes the charms of her 17th-century coaching inn will give her the edge

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Fernie Castle in Letham, Fife, where owners Neil and Mary Blackburn hope to impress their guests with their traditional 15th century B&B

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in to the Cadillac Kustomz Hotel on the Isle of Bute, where the retro design proves popular but the Scottish-American breakfast seems to get lost in translation

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Next, Liz and Dave hope the others will eat their words over the breakfast complaints they found hard to swallow at their Eden Valley Glamping site in Cumbria

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first night in Kent, 51-year-old construction site manager and part-time bouncer Mark hopes that his dinner party can be as much about the party as it is about the dinner, as he hosts a cheesy fun-fuelled evening. Will party poppers, balloons, confetti cannons and surprising celebrity stories impress 53-year-old dog-lover Karen, 39-year-old Czech shop assistant Verush, 42-year-old singer Amrick and 58-year-old fashion photographer Anthony?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the second night in Kent, competitive sales assistant Verush is going all out to win by hosting a Czech-themed evening, but ex-stripper Mark isn't impressed, comparing Verush's pasta to MDF and pastry to leather, while the first night's argument between dog lover Karen and photographer Anthony is reignited

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog enthusiast Karen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Kent, hoping to impress her guests by serving up a menu inspired by her four-legged friends. After the cheesy fun of the previous night, she is determined to impress her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amrick takes his turn to host in Kent, hoping to wow his guests by revealing his musical talents and with his traditional Indian cuisine. But with dog-lover Karen and competitive Verush not liking hot and spicy food, there could be trouble - while photographer Anthony questions ex-stripper Mark's dress sense

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Anthony attempts to wow his guests with an evening of fine food and culinary excellence on the final day of the competition in Kent. However, the soiree is jeopardised by ex-stripper Mark on overdrive and dog-lover Karen showcasing some incredible impressions from animals to Anthony himself. The host might be cockily confident he can win, but Karen seemingly remains in pole position to bag the £1,000 prize

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce puts more music enthusiasts to the test in the third heat but only one can come out victorious and secure a place in the final

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on a day at St George's during the global pandemic. Colin, 79, is rushed to the hospital after collapsing in his garage. Doctors are concerned that he has suffered a stroke, but he has also recently been diagnosed with a brain tumour. Tony is in minor injuries with crippling pain in his fingers. The 88-year-old reflects on his life, his love of dancing and how he believes the pandemic has brought out best in people

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: A surfer has a heart attack in the water, and doctors are not sure they can save him. A self-confessed 'idiot' needs treatment after falling out of a tree while holding a chainsaw. Dr Mya reassures a woman with leg injuries after she was squashed between her motorbike and a four-wheel-drive, while a teenager with a machete wound to his arm has Dr Michael on alert

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Hertfordshire, the heli-medics help a man who is fighting for his life following a cardiac arrest. A tumble on an obstacle course leaves fun-runner Vijitha with a painful open fracture. Plus, in Northumberland, seven-year-old Imogen suffers an impalement at the bike track

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Medic Shaun Murphy questions the need for an elective surgery that will allow his young patient to smile for the first time. Meanwhile, Dr Claire Browne and Dr Morgan Reznick discover that their patient lied about her identity. Drama, starring Freddie Highmore, Antonia Thomas, Chuku Modu and Fiona Gubelmann

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: A surfer has a heart attack in the water, and doctors are not sure they can save him. A self-confessed 'idiot' needs treatment after falling out of a tree while holding a chainsaw.
