The 88-year-old reflects on his life, his love of dancing and how he believes the pandemic has brought out best in people

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Another selection of favourite investigations from the team. Jimmy Doherty hears about a threat to British juniper berries that could mark the end of gin's recent resurgence in popularity, while Kate Quilton delves into the contents of herbal bedtime teas to establish if they really can help people get to sleep more easily. Big oyster fan Matt Tebbutt wonders why he never finds pearls in his seafood platters so sets off for China, where he discovers that pearl production is full of surprises

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enlists the help of paper-cutting expert Poppy Chancellor to make personalised wedding invitations for a couple about to tie the knot. Plus, the inventive presenter creates a craft collage to celebrate the arrival of a newborn baby

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Paul and Debbie from Staffordshire would love to find a holiday home on the beautiful island of Fuerteventura where they can enjoy spending quality time together. They're looking for a two-bedroom apartment near the attractive coastal town of Caleta de Fuste and have a budget of £115,000. Ben Hillman shows them five properties from them to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple buy a B&B in Portugal at the height of the Covid lockdown, a family renovate a Norfolk cottage to fund a move to Italy, and there's a new glampsite in the making in France

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The team visits Swindon and Chippenham, where Henry Cole finds and restores a much-maligned BSA Ariel 3 moped and Simon O'Brien gives a Ford Transit gearbox a new lease of life

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Henry Cole makes good money restoring an antique pine sideboard, but has less success with a pair of old brass jugs. And Simon O'Brien converts a staircase into shelves and makes an eye-watering profit from restoring an optician's desk

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers search for the heirs of an unclaimed estate, and reveal the story of a woman who left her native Ireland in the 1950s and was not heard of again until she died leaving a legacy of £1.7million. Plus, more details of unclaimed assets

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers struggle with an estate that involves a series of wills dating back to the 19th century, and when a vicar dies in Surrey, the team returns to Middlesbrough to delve into its steelmaking history. Plus, details of unclaimed estates for which heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at My Way Guest House in Broompark, Co Durham, where Kaye Horner and her daughter Lily are counting on their cleanliness to gain top marks

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the Old Orleton Inn in Wellington, Shropshire, where an award-winning breakfast is on offer - but a lack of showers does not go down well

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Ambles House in Northampton, where Amanda hopes her homely hospitality will win over her guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Richard and Harriet Secular pride themselves on their high-end rooms at the Royal George in Tintern in Monmouthshire - and the guests are not disappointed, with plenty of praise for the hosts throughout the two days. Will the feedback mirror their experience?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up for a final showdown, as Kaye and Lily bring Harriet and Richard's blind issues to light before dishing the dirt on Sophie and David's discoveries. Amanda wants to know why frank feelings were unleased when it came to her canine companion, Trudy. David and Sophie banish Harriet and Richard's bathroom blues, before confronting Kaye and Lily with their cleanliness critique. After opinions are aired and differences debated, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: It's nightfall at Chester and the zoo's 800 nocturnal inhabitants start to wake up. Aardvark Koos is showing a potentially romantic interest in his sister Himba, but the zoo needs to ensure that their animals are breeding from the right genetic pool. It's also time for mouse-deer Una to leave her parents and meet a mate

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity. Londoners Roshni and Jay meet two very different dogs - Bella the confident, playful Staffie, and Cech the shy but cuddly terrier. Bella seems to warm to Jay, but it's Roshni who has the final say. Olivia the blind spaniel is looking for a home and funeral workers Amy and Alex want to rescue a dog in need

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Gallery owner Elinor and fitness entrepreneur Born set themselves the task of creating Britain's first hypoallergenic house in a leafy back garden plot in south-west London. Driven by the need to alleviate their two young sons' life-threatening allergies, their new part-submerged, shed-inspired home, will be constructed using low toxin materials and deploy cutting-edge filtration systems to clean the air they breathe. Will their innovative new house deliver the benefits Elinor and Born are hoping for?

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie shares clever ways to make meat stretch further, preparing meatball kebabs on a bed of creamy lentils and rice, and crispy pork noodles with sticky ginger and garlic, making super-speedy homemade noodles from just flour and water. Plus, Karan Gokani shares some tips on Sri Lankan cooking that can deliver takeaway flavours without takeaway prices

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary featuring real-life footage - from the funny to the dramatic - showing what can go wrong both on and off the train tracks. From shocking near-misses and devastating derailments to rush-hour rage and unique on-board entertainment, all captured on cameras and phones and told by the people who witnessed and survived them. Plus, psychologists and industry experts discuss train-related anxieties and situations that passengers could experience in and around the railways

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Anthony is rushed to resus after coming off his motor scooter on his 18th birthday. Doctors are concerned that he has internal bleeding. Sixteen-year-old Jack is urgently transferred from another hospital with multiple fractures and nerve damage in his arm after he fell off his electric scooter. After twisting his ankle at school, 13-year-old Josh has been brought to the emergency department by his father, Sanjay, who explains how he left India for the UK to pursue a career as a chef

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The heli-medics race to assist Linda, who has suffered a heart attack on a Norfolk beach. Motocross rider Alex is in a bad way after being hit by another bike. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, 15-year-old cyclist Dan is treated for a possible skull fracture after colliding with a car on a country road

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman at the airport suffers a suspected miscarriage, but the paramedics sent to her aid have trouble getting her back to hospital due to heavy snowfall. Crews also battle through the roads to treat a woman semi-conscious in police custody with collapsed veins

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer head to Norfolk, where they attempt to ensnare a large pike - a fish that has eluded them on their trips so far. programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing

The Mayflies are hatching, and the famously short-lived insects inspire some thoughts on the ephemeral nature of life, and what they would do if they only had 24 hours left

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. Does one of the contestants really apologise to their boiled egg before smashing its head in? Who apparently writes Christmas cards with their feet? And did one of the line-up really prevent their bandmate joining the Beatles?

The chef tastes this ancient Christmas treat and, inspired by its flavour combinations, creates his own chocolate version. Next, he visits some Benedictine monks and tours their vast vineyard, before using their Tuscan red wine in his recipe for marinated beef skewers and three-bean salad

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: The final leg of Gino D'Acampo's tour takes him to Bologna, widely regarded as Italy's gastronomic capital. Making his way to a trattoria, he meets a chef who has been honing her bolognese sauce recipe for almost 30 years. Gino then prepares his grandfather's take on tagliatelle alla bolognese and explores the local speciality of mortadella. Finally, he goes on the trail of the region's distinctive local pasta - tortellini - and creates his own version with ricotta cheese, hazelnuts, orange zest and chocolate chips

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Minneapolis and St Paul, where he learns how the power of the Mississippi helped Minneapolis become a great industrial centre. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the scenery of rural and coastal Scotland as he travels from Stirling to John O'Groats. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the second leg of his journey from Stirling to John O'Groats, Michael Portillo travels from Dundee to Aberdeen. Along the way he learns how Queen Victoria used to hide from her subjects and discovers why some factory workers went deaf

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Crewe, a town steeped in railway history, to investigate the making of cinema classic The Night Mail during the 1930s. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Crossing the Menai Strait by the Britannia Bridge, Michael arrives on Anglesey and the elegant seat of the Marquesses of the island

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows in the footsteps of engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel as he travels from London to Newton Abbot in Devon. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Salisbury in Wiltshire to Castle Cary, Somerset, visiting a world-famous tourist spot that has been captivating visitors since the Victorian era. He also takes to the air in Yeovil and tries his hand at clothmaking the 19th-century way

programme.desc: Chris sets out on a mission to cross three former Soviet republics entirely by rail in just one week, travelling through Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania and uncovering amazing stories and dark secrets from the region's past. He begins in Narva, Estonia, before heading to the capital Tallinn on the country's oldest railway, built by German nobles to connect the Russian imperial capital St Petersburg with Estonia's ports, then travelling through Latvia and Lithuania and heading to the Russian border on a revolutionary new line

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. From Slovenia, Chris heads east along an old Austro-Hungarian railway that was once used by the Orient Express, pays a visit to a very unusual railway-related battlefield in Bosnia and rides on one of the world's great mountain railways on his way to the Serbian capital Belgrade before finishing his journey in Montenegro

programme.desc: Yvonne and Graham want a holiday bolthole in the Algarve, as close as possible to the harbour and beach, so Ben Hillman lines up five contenders for their budget of £135,000

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets a master craftsman whose dream is to build a castle in rural Devon made entirely of mud. Kevin McCabe plans to form the huge property out of two vast curved roundhouses - the largest of which is inspired by the natural geometry of a snail shell - connected by glazing and topped with wildflower meadow roofs to mirror the surrounding countryside. However, the project involves mixing and laying a mind-boggling 2,000 tons of cob, all during warm, sunny weather - and the sheer scale of the task soon becomes clear

Christine enlists the help of fellow sales brokers Tessa and Amy to help close a deal on a Grade I listed Georgian townhouse in Bath and a modern country home just outside Henley. The zoo also has four rare new arrivals called tenrecs, mysterious mammals from Madagascar and, with so little known about them, the keepers try everything they can to help them breed, while red river hog Mali has given birth to twins, but tearaway dad Confetti is a threat to his own babies

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King comes to the help of Kerry and Stewart from Newcastle who, with five children and eight grandchildren, are looking forward to finding a little oasis on the Canary island of Lanzarote that they can all escape to. Leah lines up five properties for thepair to consider within their budget of £120,000

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George heads to Kent to help Pete and Amelie make their huge 16 room Victorian house fit for modern life, with plans to make a playroom and a library. Amelie makes a trip to Shropshire to make her own encaustic tiles in one of the last remaining factories in the country to use traditional methods. Plus, George revisits Michele in Warwickshire to see how she is getting on remodelling her adjoining Grade II listed cottages

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: A mother and daughter need help from Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer as their three-bedroom Victorian cottage in Great Bookham, Surrey is too small and dark. Mum Abi cannot bear to leave the place she lived with her partner, who passed away a few years ago. But daughter Maddy believes her mum needs a fresh start

programme.title: Den of Thieves (2018)
programme.desc: An elite unit of the Los Angeles county sheriffs' department investigates a series of perfectly executed heists, and uncovers a criminal gang composed of military veterans, whose strategic and combat experience make them an elusive foe. The investigators set out to bring them to justice before they can carry out their biggest robbery yet - stealing $120million from the Federal Reserve Bank. Director Christian Gudegast's crime drama, starring Gerard Butler and Jordan Bridges

24 Hours in A&E

Plus, nurse Jess talks about her stammer

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Using previously classified KGB documents, the second part of this film explores how far Soviet leaders were willing to go to cover up the Chernobyl disaster, including exposing children to toxic fallout at the Kyiv May Day parade to prove to the world that all was fine. Featuring first-hand accounts from those who survived the blast, including Oleksiy Ananenko, who braved radioactive waters to prevent a deadlier second explosion and Maryna Sivets, whose unborn child's life was put at risk

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates this behind-the-scenes look at the biggest players in Britain's crisp industry. The snack aisle is a brutal place, where every cheesy puff, crisp and tortilla chip fights for its place on the shelf. This programme meets the crisp industry's biggest players, whose job it was to make sure their brand stays ahead of the competition, no matter what. It's a fierce battleground where three brands - Smiths, Golden Wonder and Walkers - have fought for decades to out-flavour, out-sell and outwit their rivals to achieve complete crisp domination

Meanwhile, Bishop and Jake discuss their marital problems. Naval crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham, with Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A cosmetics company is rocked by the revelation that a pirated version of their latest product is on the market, and then, shortly afterwards, one of their chemists is found murdered. But when the shabby sleuth scrutinises the case, he suspects the events are linked to a rival company. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Vincent Price, Martin Sheen and Vera Miles

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A crooked lawyer hopes to start a promising political career, but a former client he saved from prison threatens to blow the whistle on him. The attorney murders the blackmailer and makes it look like suicide - but the shabby sleuth sees through his ruse and sets out to expose the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Louis Zorich and Patrick McGoohan, who also directed

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An ambitious Hollywood director is visited by an old friend, who threatens to expose evidence of his involvement in the death of an actor. The film-maker resorts to murder to keep his dark secret safe, only to end up on the receiving end of Columbo's distinctive brand of interrogation. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Fisher Stevens and Molly Hagan

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The dishevelled detective suspects a highly respected general is guilty of murdering an associate who was about to expose the war hero's shady business dealings, but Columbo has a hard time backing up his hunch with evidence because of the lack of a body or a weapon. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Eddie Albert, Suzanne Pleshette and John Kerr

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An accountant who has a reputation as being one of the brightest men in the world realises he has to kill a fellow genius to cover up his illegal activities. He puts his remarkable intelligence to the task of covering up every possible clue that could lead back to him - but has not counted on the equally sharp mind of slovenly sleuth Columbo. Crime drama, with Peter Falk and Theodore Bikel

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The crumpled cop investigates when a private eye murders his client's adulterous wife because she refuses to submit to his blackmail threats, and arranges the crime scene to make it look as if she was the victim of a mugging gone wrong. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Ray Milland and Robert Culp

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A radio presenter is plotting to sabotage his adopted daughter's plans to publish her first novel and kills one of his employees for trying to help her. He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team sets out to track down a serial rapist, and traces the culprit to a homeless shelter, where the trail goes cold. Undeterred, Carisi decides to go undercover in an attempt to reveal the perpetrator's identity. New York-set police crime drama, directed by and starring Mariska Hargitay, with Peter Scanavino

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team tries to prevent a miscarriage of justice after a young model is raped by a renowned fashion photographer, who looks to his successful brother to make the charges disappear. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hartigay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham

programme.title: NCIS

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a clothes shop owner during an apparent robbery. programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order

However, Briscoe is not convinced, and suspects an extortion scheme

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

Ealing comedy drama, starring Tommy Trinder, James Mason, Mervyn Johns and William Hartnell

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Coronation Street stars past and present - Keith Duffy (Ciaran McCarthy) and Jennie McAlpine (Fiz Stape) - take part in the game show, teaming up with their relatives to guess the answers to surveys of 100 people in a bid to reach the final round, where they can win up to £30,000 for a charity of their choice. Presented by Vernon Kay

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
